commit_message:
Apply six for metaclass

__metaclass__ cannot be used in python3.
six be used in general for python 3 compatibility.

Change-Id: I5b3a55bd8a43bbc9c75fcc7f005d31c4af102c3f

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-30 19:41:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/zaqar/commit/77d0588f9683d23b2c040409456784c03ac1243b', 'message': 'feat(sql/driver): expose ControlDriver, more config

- Skeleton of ControlDriver written

With configuration, the following parameters are exposed:

- dialect
- driver
- user
- password

- dbname

commit_message:
feat(sql/driver): expose ControlDriver, more config

This patch adds two features to our current sqlalchemy driver:

- option to configure connection URI for driver
- Skeleton of ControlDriver written

With the ControlDriver, the expected methods were stubbed out.

Small fix: all controller methods not yet implemented now raise
NotImplementedError.

Change-Id: I1cd4a4d75cbbee7f0ff574c5be4d11660359ab7e
Partially-Implements: blueprint: sql-storage-driver
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/02/70202/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cfg.StrOpt('dialect', default='sqlite', help='Type of database to use: sqlite, postgresql, etc.'), cfg.StrOpt('driver', default='pysqlite', help='Driver to use with dialect: psycopg2, etc.'), cfg.StrOpt('user', default='', help='User name to connect with.'), cfg.StrOpt('password', default='', help='Password to authenticate with.'), cfg.StrOpt('host', default='localhost', help='Hostname of the database server.'), help='Database name to use.')def _engine_url(dialect, driver, user, password, host, dbname): """Constructs a URL adequate for use with sqlalchemy.create_engine. Arguments map to configuration options in drivers:storage:sqlalchemy. See sqlalchemy.create_engine documentation for their full meaning. """ template = u'{dialect}+{driver}://{user}:{password}@{host}/{dbname}' return template.format( dialect=dialect, driver=driver, user=user, password=password, host=host, dbname=dbname ) self.conf.register_opts(_SQLALCHEMY_OPTIONS, group=_SQLALCHEMY_GROUP) self._path = _engine_url( dialect=self.sqlachemy_conf.dialect, driver=self.sqlalchemy_conf.driver, user=self.sqlalchemy_conf.user, password=self.sqlalchemy_conf.password, host=self.sqlalchemy_conf.host, dbname=self.sqlalchemy_conf.dbname ) engine = sa.create_engine(self._path, **kwargs) # TODO(cpp-cabrera): expose connect/close as a context manager # that acquires the connection to the DB for the desired scope and # closes it once the operations are completed raise NotImplementedError() raise NotImplementedError() raise NotImplementedError() class ControlDriver(storage.ControlDriverBase): def __init__(self, conf, cache): super(ControlDriver, self).__init__(conf, cache) self.conf.register_opts(_SQLALCHEMY_OPTIONS, group=_SQLALCHEMY_GROUP) self.sqlalchemy_conf = self.conf[_SQLALCHEMY_GROUP] self._path = _engine_url( dialect=self.sqlachemy_conf.dialect, driver=self.sqlalchemy_conf.driver, user=self.sqlalchemy_conf.user, password=self.sqlalchemy_conf.password, host=self.sqlalchemy_conf.host, dbname=self.sqlalchemy_conf.dbname ) @decorators.lazy_property(write=False) def engine(self, *args, **kwargs): engine = sa.create_engine(self._path, **kwargs) tables.metadata.create_all(engine, checkfirst=True) return engine # TODO(cpp-cabrera): expose connect/close as a context manager # that acquires the connection to the DB for the desired scope and # closes it once the operations are completed @decorators.lazy_property(write=False) def connection(self): return self.engine.connect() def close_connection(self): self.connection.close() @property def shards_controller(self): raise NotImplementedError() @property def catalogue_controller(self): raise NotImplementedError()
deleted_lines: help='Sqlalchemy database to use.') self.conf.register_opts(_SQLALCHEMY_OPTIONS, group=_SQLALCHEMY_GROUP) self.__path = self.sqlalchemy_conf.database engine = sa.create_engine(*args, **kwargs) return None return None return None

commit_message:
Removed XREF to old blog entry in Ceph section

Removed reference to old blog entry (06/2012) in "Ceph RADOS Block
Device (RBD)" section of Config Reference Guide.

I only removed the paragraph that qualified the blog entry as a source
of "detailed installation instructions". The entry mentions 'nova
volume', which is no longer in use AFAIK.

Change-Id: Id996909f0568e74fa59c2f99044ad61e49d4760c
Closes-Bug: #1279132

commit_message:
Shorten swift-internal:// to swift://

The internal/external distinction can be handled with meta-data
instead of encoding it within the url. So we can simply start using
swift://.

This patch keeps the swift-internal:// option around until we decide
it can simply be removed.

Change-Id: I5ea3d93319daf426539abc78ae826b6594035df9
Implements: blueprint swift-url-proto-cleanup

commit_message:
Fixes environment file using correct YAML format

An internal unexpected exception is raised while create a stack with an
environment file which only has string content. We should handle the case
and raise the correct error message such as "environment file is not Yaml
format".

Change-Id: I4e124db6a8dca9cf811f151ae95058cdaae16a01
Closes-Bug: #1273974
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient refs/changes/02/69802/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: YAML format. if not isinstance(env, dict): raise ValueError('The environment is not YAML mapping.')

commit_message:
Raise the default max header to accommodate large tokens

PKI tokens hit the default limit if there is enough
services defined in the keystone catalog.

Also the v3 catalog is larger than the v2 catalog which would explain
why this bug is being hit just now.

This change adds the configuration option max_header_line to each of the
API confurations which has a default of 16384.

Closes-Bug: #1190149
Change-Id: I5da09aa08a1242c5e356bd8bf532baa9347ce075
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/89/70289/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Raise the default from 8192 to accommodate large tokens eventlet.wsgi.MAX_HEADER_LINE = 16384

Implements complex query functionality for alarms

New API resource /query/alarms has been added

Implements: blueprint complex-filter-expressions-in-api-queries
Change-Id: I3289f187c70a74d19381c24a20d324c2d14a19fb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/58/62158/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def query_alarms(self, filter_=[], orderby=[], limit=None): """Yields a lists of alarms that match filter """ if limit == 0: return session = sqlalchemy_session.get_session() query = session.query(models.Alarm) if filter_: sql_condition = self._transform_to_sqlalchemy(filter_, models.Alarm) query = query.filter(sql_condition) query = self._apply_order_by(query, orderby, models.Alarm) if limit: query = query.limit(limit) return (self._row_to_alarm_model(x) for x in query.all())

commit_message:
Add JSONEncodedType with enforced type checking

Add abstract base class for JSONEncoded properties which: 1. Does type
checking to make sure we're serializing what we really expect
2. Ensures that default value of the field matches default value of
that type, so we have consistent interface. This patch creates two child
classes JSONEncodedDict and JSONEncodedList and updates SA models
correspondingly.

Change-Id: I528ac64e998e9a874feb16709d7617feb4b09c8a
Closes-Bug: #1270146
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/13/68413/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if value is None: # Save empty dict by default to make the interface the consistent. value = dict() serialized_value = json.dumps(value) return serialized_value
deleted_lines: if value is not None: value = json.dumps(value) return value

While doing some work around swiftclient Python 3 support, httplib

commit_message:
Move location of HTTPException in swift_testing

While doing some work around swiftclient Python 3 support, httplib
imports were changed to use six.moves in order to access httplib in Py2
and http.client in Py3. Tests related to those changes are failing
because these functional tests are depending on HTTPException being
a name in swiftclient.client. These tests should acces that name from
its canonical location in httplib (or, eventually, a Py3 friendly
location like six.moves).

Conflicts:
	test/functionalnosetests/swift_testing.py

Change-Id: I6335d465574045daedab47e5fe23c415d171a83a
(cherry picked from commit 180cd18da64b59c39ec1696e4316b18711d1fb82)

commit_message:
Fix parsing of AMQP configuration

The deprecated notifier_strategy option is always used even if it is set
to its default value and the new notification_driver option is
explicitly set.

This change makes the notification_driver option work.

Change-Id: Icc2a063a828472132d2e2eda7f12e265db990ea1
Closes-Bug: #1271724

commit_message:
Tell install to create files as 644 instead of 755

The ``install`` command defaults to 755, this will tell it to use
644 for the config files.

Change-Id: Ic03307d86e11dcab017e754ec3ac10105ac6bb79

added_lines: <para>When you create a deployment plan, focus on a few vital areas because they are very hard to modify post-deployment. The next two sections talk about configurations for:</para> <para> <itemizedlist> <listitem> <para>Disk partioning and disk array setup for scalability</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Networking configuration just for PXE booting</para> </listitem> </itemizedlist> </para> <tip><para>You may find that you can automate the partitioning itself. For example, at MIT they use Fully Automatic Installation (FAI) (<link xlink:href="http://fai-project.org/" >fai-project.org/</link>) to do the initial PXE-based partition and install using some min/max and percentage-based partitioning.</para></tip> <tip><para>For further research about OpenStack deployment, investigate the >SwiftStack</link>.</para></tip>

For example, at MIT they use Fully Automatic Installation (FAI) (<link xlink:href="http://fai-project.org/">fai-project.org/</link>) to do the initial PXE-based partition and install using some min/max and percentage-based partitioning.</para> <para>For further research about OpenStack deployment, investigate the >SwiftStack</link>.</para>

subject: Make is_neutron() thread-safe
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-08 21:45:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/cb315261c4f0948b0b7865b1371b09b82457098e', 'message': 'Make is_neutron() thread-safe

The utils method is_neutron() was not thread safe and could have returned the
wrong value if two greenthreads called it at the same time.  Specifically, a
greenthread switch could occur when the import is being done.  At that point, it
looks like the check has already been completed, but the result has not yet been
recorded.

Closes-bug: #1274992
Change-Id: I5a6eedaeb4c0deee4b31509946ae5daedf98389d
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-14 00:45:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/6a4b7d06bd574e87e8f293c16b86f1ee8e2444fc', 'message': 'Make is_neutron() thread-safe

The utils method is_neutron() was not thread safe and could have returned the
wrong value if two greenthreads called it at the same time.  Specifically, a
greenthread switch could occur when the import is being done.  At that point, it
looks like the check has already been completed, but the result has not yet been
recorded.

Closes-bug: #1274992

commit_message:
Make is_neutron() thread-safe

The utils method is_neutron() was not thread safe and could have returned the
wrong value if two greenthreads called it at the same time.  Specifically, a
greenthread switch could occur when the import is being done.  At that point, it
looks like the check has already been completed, but the result has not yet been
recorded.

Closes-bug: #1274992
Change-Id: I5a6eedaeb4c0deee4b31509946ae5daedf98389d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/25/72125/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Setup code for auto-config sample generation

Sync in the oslo code for auto-config sample generation and
make the appropriate changes to setup to allow for automatic
option discovery.

`test-requirements.txt` now includes stevedore to
ensure the oslo libraries can all be loaded as expected.

Change-Id: Ieca0aea4d3c67b930c12467317d2f4d83763b601

commit_message:
Implement a native nested stack resource OS::Heat::Stack

For now this is a simple subclass with renamed properties.

The existing tests have been refactored so that all templates are
defined at the class level, so full test coverage for OS::Heat::Stack
is gained by subclassing each test with a modified template.

Implements blueprint native-nested-stack

Change-Id: I3f8f1fed93b899d72b93bcceac7628974706f24b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/97/72497/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class HeatNestedStack(NestedStack): ''' A Resource representing a child stack to allow composition of templates. ''' PROPERTIES = ( TEMPLATE_URL, TIMEOUT_IN_MINS, PARAMETERS, ) = ( 'template_url', 'timeout_minutes', 'parameters', ) properties_schema = { TEMPLATE_URL: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('The URL of a template that specifies the stack to be created ' 'as a resource.'), required=True, update_allowed=True ), TIMEOUT_IN_MINS: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.NUMBER, _('The length of time, in minutes, to wait for the nested stack ' 'creation.'), update_allowed=True ), PARAMETERS: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.MAP, _('The set of parameters passed to this nested stack.'), update_allowed=True ), } 'OS::Heat::Stack': HeatNestedStack,

commit_message:
Fix dev-quick-start.rst post landing for 9d81333fd0

Fixing:
* Add missing -r option to the pip install command
* Add a step to start rabbitmq-server on fedora/rhel after the
  installation
* Replace the systemctl command with service because RHEL <= 6 doesn't
  use systemd
* auth_strategy option can't be appended at the end of the file and
  should be edited under the [DEFAULT] section
* Remove the trailing space

Change-Id: Id9b8a3e2b8c0358ddfc6693fb0cda410a40a4186
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/42/73642/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: # install requirements within the virtualenv pip install -U -r requirements.txt test-requirements.txt cat >> etc/ironic/ironic.conf.local <<EOL host = test-host auth_strategy = noauth EOL sudo systemctl start httpd

Use six.moves.urllib.parse instead of urlparse

To keep Python 3.x compatibility, use six.moves.urllib.parse to
replace urlparse.

Partial-Bug: #1279611

commit_message:
Add run_test.sh for running tests

This is a copy of the test entry point used in Nova, Swift, Keystone,
Tuskar, Glance, Horizon, Neutron, Heat, Cinder, and others. It
provides a simple way to add consistency and repeatability to running
tests w/ minimal human effort, just run ./run_tests.sh.

Change-Id: I5469cdeacb933d30868596e5bb9e767b17ab44d2

added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # Copyright 2010 United States Government as represented by the # Administrator of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration. # All Rights Reserved. # # Copyright 2010 OpenStack Foundation # Copyright 2013 IBM Corp. # Copyright (c) 2013 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import ConfigParser import os import sys import install_venv_common as install_venv # flake8: noqa def print_help(project, venv, root): help = """ %(project)s development environment setup is complete. %(project)s development uses virtualenv to track and manage Python dependencies while in development and testing. To activate the %(project)s virtualenv for the extent of your current shell session you can run: $ source %(venv)s/bin/activate Or, if you prefer, you can run commands in the virtualenv on a case by case basis by running: $ %(root)s/tools/with_venv.sh <your command> """ print help % dict(project=project, venv=venv, root=root) def main(argv): root = os.path.dirname(os.path.dirname(os.path.realpath(__file__))) if os.environ.get('tools_path'): root = os.environ['tools_path'] venv = os.path.join(root, '.venv') if os.environ.get('venv'): venv = os.environ['venv'] pip_requires = os.path.join(root, 'requirements.txt') test_requires = os.path.join(root, 'test-requirements.txt') py_version = "python%s.%s" % (sys.version_info[0], sys.version_info[1]) setup_cfg = ConfigParser.ConfigParser() setup_cfg.read('setup.cfg') project = setup_cfg.get('metadata', 'name') install = install_venv.InstallVenv( root, venv, pip_requires, test_requires, py_version, project) options = install.parse_args(argv) install.check_python_version() install.check_dependencies() install.create_virtualenv(no_site_packages=options.no_site_packages) install.install_dependencies() install.post_process() print_help(project, venv, root) if __name__ == '__main__': main(sys.argv)

commit_message:
Add support for software config resources

SoftwareConfig lacks update methods as it is immutable.

Implements: blueprint hot-software-config-rest

Change-Id: I1d05433303c182f03d21378fd66af4f589b7821b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient refs/changes/85/58885/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2012 OpenStack Foundation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from heatclient.common import base class SoftwareConfig(base.Resource): def __repr__(self): return "<SoftwareConfig %s>" % self._info def delete(self): return self.manager.delete(self) def data(self, **kwargs): return self.manager.data(self, **kwargs) class SoftwareConfigManager(base.Manager): resource_class = SoftwareConfig def list(self): """Get a list of software configs. :rtype: list of :class:`SoftwareConfig` """ url = '/software_configs' return self._list(url, "software_configs") def get(self, config_id): """Get the details for a specific software config. :param config_id: ID of the software config """ resp, body = self.api.json_request('GET', '/software_configs/%s' % config_id) return SoftwareConfig(self, body['software_config']) def create(self, **kwargs): """Create a software config.""" resp, body = self.api.json_request('POST', '/software_configs', body=kwargs) return SoftwareConfig(self, body['software_config']) def delete(self, config_id): """Delete a software config.""" self._delete("/software_configs/%s" % config_id)

commit_message:
Use uuid instead of uuidutils

Glance no longer import uuidutils from Oslo.
This patch replaces uuidutils.generate_uuid() with
str(uuid.uuid4()).

Change-Id: I463324cefe488138d709ffe0cc4a587d6ecaa850
Related-Bug: #1253497

OAuth and assignment notifications that will
trigger revocation events.

added_lines: from keystone import notifications @notifications.created("OS-OAUTH1:consumer") def create_consumer(self, consumer_ref): return self.driver.create_consumer(consumer_ref) @notifications.updated("OS-OAUTH1:consumer") def update_consumer(self, consumer_id, consumer_ref): return self.driver.update_consumer(consumer_id, consumer_ref) @notifications.deleted("OS-OAUTH1:consumer") def delete_consumer(self, consumer_id): return self.driver.delete_consumer(consumer_id) @notifications.created("OS-OAUTH1:access_token") def create_access_token(self, request_id, access_token_duration): return self.driver.create_access_token(request_id, access_token_duration) @notifications.deleted("OS-OAUTH1:access_token", arg_index=2) def delete_access_token(self, user_id, access_token_id): return self.driver.delete_access_token(user_id, access_token_id)

commit_message:
Removes os-instance-usage-audit-log from the V3 API

The extension pre-dates ceilometer and equivalent
functionality is now much better managed using
ceilometer. So we're removing this before the V3 API
is officially released.

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-remove-extensions

Change-Id: I9b7892346a4ad7c54a903cfcbcb97156dfc8c734

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-13 06:17:16.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/slo.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_slo.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/a519579c606725d7a63aac2ca9f8a1e4520b77b1', 'message': "Small efficiency improvement for SLO range GET

If a client sends a GET request with a Range header for a SLO
manifest, SLO would notice this and perform a second GET request, sans
Range header, to retrieve the manifest body. Most of the time, this is
the sane thing to do: a subset of a SLO manifest is pretty much
useless. However, if the client has requested the first N bytes of the
large object, and the SLO manifest has N or fewer bytes, then the
response will actually have the whole manifest in it, so SLO doesn't
need to make a second request. (It's not wrong, just inefficient.)

Fortunately, ranged GET responses come with a Content-Range header
that tells us first byte, last byte, and total content length. Now SLO
detects whether or not a ranged GET response contains the full

Change-Id: I63b991e08a1165eb3e88bd0620a1e64ef056fec6

commit_message:
Small efficiency improvement for SLO range GET

If a client sends a GET request with a Range header for a SLO
manifest, SLO would notice this and perform a second GET request, sans
Range header, to retrieve the manifest body. Most of the time, this is
the sane thing to do: a subset of a SLO manifest is pretty much
useless. However, if the client has requested the first N bytes of the
large object, and the SLO manifest has N or fewer bytes, then the
response will actually have the whole manifest in it, so SLO doesn't
need to make a second request. (It's not wrong, just inefficient.)

Fortunately, ranged GET responses come with a Content-Range header
that tells us first byte, last byte, and total content length. Now SLO
detects whether or not a ranged GET response contains the full
manifest, and if so, just uses the existing response instead of making
another.

Change-Id: I63b991e08a1165eb3e88bd0620a1e64ef056fec6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/61/73161/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_range_get_includes_whole_manifest(self): # If the first range GET results in retrieval of the entire manifest # body (which we can detect by looking at Content-Range), then we # should not go make a second, non-ranged request just to retrieve the # same bytes again. req = Request.blank( '/v1/AUTH_test/gettest/manifest-abcd', environ={'REQUEST_METHOD': 'GET'}, headers={'Range': 'bytes=0-999999999'}) status, headers, body = self.call_slo(req) headers = swob.HeaderKeyDict(headers) self.assertEqual(status, '206 Partial Content') self.assertEqual( body, 'aaaaabbbbbbbbbbcccccccccccccccdddddddddddddddddddd') self.assertEqual( self.app.calls, [('GET', '/v1/AUTH_test/gettest/manifest-abcd'), ('GET', '/v1/AUTH_test/gettest/a_5'), ('GET', '/v1/AUTH_test/gettest/manifest-bc'), ('GET', '/v1/AUTH_test/gettest/b_10'), ('GET', '/v1/AUTH_test/gettest/c_15'), ('GET', '/v1/AUTH_test/gettest/d_20')]) def test_range_get_beyond_manifest(self): big = 'e' * 1024 * 1024 big_etag = md5(big).hexdigest() self.app.register( 'GET', '/v1/AUTH_test/gettest/big_seg', swob.HTTPOk, {'Content-Type': 'application/foo', 'Etag': big_etag}, big) big_manifest = json.dumps( [{'name': '/gettest/big_seg', 'hash': big_etag, 'bytes': 1024 * 1024, 'content_type': 'application/foo'}]) self.app.register( 'GET', '/v1/AUTH_test/gettest/big_manifest', swob.HTTPOk, {'Content-Type': 'application/octet-stream', 'X-Static-Large-Object': 'true', 'Etag': md5(big_manifest).hexdigest()}, big_manifest) req = Request.blank( '/v1/AUTH_test/gettest/big_manifest', environ={'REQUEST_METHOD': 'GET'}, headers={'Range': 'bytes=100000-199999'}) status, headers, body = self.call_slo(req) headers = swob.HeaderKeyDict(headers) self.assertEqual(status, '206 Partial Content') self.assertEqual(body, 'e' * 100000) self.assertEqual( self.app.calls, [ # has Range header, gets 416 ('GET', '/v1/AUTH_test/gettest/big_manifest'), # retry the first one ('GET', '/v1/AUTH_test/gettest/big_manifest'), ('GET', '/v1/AUTH_test/gettest/big_seg')]) def test_range_get_bogus_content_range(self): # Just a little paranoia; Swift currently sends back valid # Content-Range headers, but if somehow someone sneaks an invalid one # in there, we'll ignore it. def content_range_breaker_factory(app): def content_range_breaker(env, start_response): req = swob.Request(env) resp = req.get_response(app) resp.headers['Content-Range'] = 'triscuits' return resp(env, start_response) return content_range_breaker self.slo = slo.filter_factory({})( content_range_breaker_factory(self.app)) req = Request.blank( '/v1/AUTH_test/gettest/manifest-abcd', environ={'REQUEST_METHOD': 'GET'}, headers={'Range': 'bytes=0-999999999'}) status, headers, body = self.call_slo(req) headers = swob.HeaderKeyDict(headers) self.assertEqual(status, '206 Partial Content') self.assertEqual( body, 'aaaaabbbbbbbbbbcccccccccccccccdddddddddddddddddddd') self.assertEqual( self.app.calls, [('GET', '/v1/AUTH_test/gettest/manifest-abcd'), ('GET', '/v1/AUTH_test/gettest/manifest-abcd'), ('GET', '/v1/AUTH_test/gettest/a_5'), ('GET', '/v1/AUTH_test/gettest/manifest-bc'), ('GET', '/v1/AUTH_test/gettest/b_10'), ('GET', '/v1/AUTH_test/gettest/c_15'), ('GET', '/v1/AUTH_test/gettest/d_20')])

commit_message:
Adds a setting for the location of the nzf files

Bind9 stores the nzf files in a configurable path, specified in
named.conf. To make sure designate looks in the right place, this patch
adds support to specify the correct path in designate.conf as well.

Change-Id: I75d3e982379b487a746987c61f9a4e0de8ff56da
Closes-Bug: 1280418

commit_message:
Stop abusing state_path in find_config

It makes no sense to look for configuration in the same location where
state is stored. Replacing state_path by pybasedir keeps current
behaviour while allowing us to change the default state_path from
Designate's install location to /var/lib/designate in a subsequent
patchset.

Change-Id: I82fed1ddde0dbc7340a6ad5dcb80dbcba72b8358

commit_message:
Set up for publishing via openstack-doc-tools

tox -e publishdocs will be called by the post jenkins jobs to prepare
everything for publishing on docs.openstack.org - and then the content
of publish-docs gets copied.

tox -e publishdocs-api is the job for api.openstack.org.

Additionally, remove parameter --api-docs from
openstack-doc-tools invocation, it is set in doc-test.conf now.

Change-Id: I84986e1572d128b85ad43863217e4d6c0b22f41f

commit_message:
Add support for Amazon VPC APIs in Openstack

- Created a separate file (vpc.py) to handle VPC APIs
- Added unit tests for VPC (test_vpc.py)

Nova EC2 extended to support Amazon VPC APIs.
Only VPC and Subnet CRUD APIs are added in this patch.
This patch has no dependency on any other blueprints.

Change-Id: I0ac1e824572ac74b488ecfaa722d7346f5ba8ccb
Implements: blueprint aws-vpc-support
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/70/49470/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # Copyright 2010 United States Government as represented by the # Administrator of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ Cloud Controller: Implementation of VPC REST API calls, which are dispatched to other nodes via AMQP RPC. State is via distributed datastore. """ from netaddr import IPNetwork from nova import exception from keystoneclient import exceptions as ke import keystoneclient.v2_0 from nova.network import neutronv2 import uuid class VpcController(object): """ VpcController provides the critical dispatch between inbound API calls through the endpoint and messages sent to the other nodes. """ def _get_keystone_client(self, context): if self.kc is None: auth_url = "http://%s:5000/v2.0" % self.kc_ip self.kc = keystoneclient.v2_0.client.Client( token=context.auth_token, username=context.user_name, tenant_name=context.project_name, auth_url=auth_url) return self.kc def _get_tenantid_from_vpcid(self, vpc_id, context): try: kc = self._get_keystone_client(context) tenant_list = kc.tenants.list() found = False for tenant in tenant_list: if tenant.name == vpc_id: tenant_id = tenant.id found = True break if not found: raise exception.InvalidParameterValue(err='No VPC found') except Exception as e: raise exception.EC2APIError('Keystone exception %s' % e) return tenant_id def create_vpc(self, context, **kwargs): # check if cidr address mask between 16 and 28 if int(kwargs['cidr_block'].split('/')[1]) not in range(16, 29): msg = 'Subnet Mask should be between 16 and 28' raise exception.InvalidParameterValue(err=msg) # create project for vpc try: tenant_name = 'vpc-' + ('%x' % uuid.uuid4().time_low) kc = self._get_keystone_client(context) tenant_id = kc.tenants.create(tenant_name) except ke.ClientException as e: raise exception.EC2APIError(e) # create a network to store vpc cidr try: neutron = neutronv2.get_client(context) nw_name = 'subnet-' + tenant_name net_req = {'name': nw_name, 'tenant_id': tenant_id.id} net_rsp = neutron.create_network({'network': net_req}) subnet_req = {'network_id': net_rsp['network']['id'], 'cidr': unicode(kwargs['cidr_block']), 'ip_version': 4, 'tenant_id': tenant_id.id} neutron.create_subnet({'subnet': subnet_req}) except Exception as e: raise exception.EC2APIError(e) return {'vpc': {'vpcId': tenant_name, 'state': 'available'}} def delete_vpc(self, context, **kwargs): vpc_id = kwargs['vpc_id'] tenant_id = self._get_tenantid_from_vpcid(vpc_id, context) neutron = neutronv2.get_client(context) # delete network and subnet that stores VPC cidr try: network_rsp = neutron.list_networks(tenant_id=tenant_id) except Exception as e: raise exception.EC2APIError(e) cidr_network = 'subnet-' + str(vpc_id) for network in network_rsp['networks']: if network['name'] != cidr_network: continue try: subnets_rsp = neutron.list_subnets(network_id=network['id']) for subnet in subnets_rsp['subnets']: neutron.delete_subnet(subnet['id']) neutron.delete_network(network['id']) except Exception as e: raise exception.EC2APIError(e) # delete project for the passed vpc try: kc = self._get_keystone_client(context) vpc_list = kc.tenants.list() for vpc in vpc_list: if vpc.name == vpc_id: kc.tenants.delete(vpc) except ke.ClientException as e: raise exception.EC2APIError(e) return {'return': 'true'} def describe_vpcs(self, context, **kwargs): # fetch tenant list try: kc = self._get_keystone_client(context) tenant_list = kc.tenants.list() except ke.ClientException as e: raise exception.EC2APIError(e) # list of vpcs vpcs = [] for tenant in tenant_list: if 'vpc_id' in kwargs and tenant.name not in kwargs['vpc_id']: continue if not tenant.name.startswith('vpc-'): continue try: neutron = neutronv2.get_client(context) tenant_id = self._get_tenantid_from_vpcid(tenant.name, context) network_rsp = neutron.list_networks(tenant_id=tenant_id) except Exception as e: raise exception.EC2APIError(e) item = {} cidr_network = 'subnet-' + tenant.name for network in network_rsp['networks']: if network['name'] != cidr_network: continue try: subnets_rsp = neutron.list_subnets( network_id=network['id']) for subnet in subnets_rsp['subnets']: cidr_block = subnet['cidr'] except Exception as e: raise exception.EC2APIError(e) # populate the VPC entry in response item['vpcId'] = tenant.name item['state'] = 'available' item['cidrBlock'] = str(cidr_block) if item: vpcs.append(item) return {'vpcSet': vpcs} def create_subnet(self, context, **kwargs): vpc_id = kwargs['vpc_id'] cidr_block = kwargs['cidr_block'] subnet_ip_block = IPNetwork(cidr_block) # get project id tenant_id = self._get_tenantid_from_vpcid(vpc_id, context) neutron = neutronv2.get_client(context) # check if subnet cidr in vpc cidr try: network_rsp = neutron.list_networks(tenant_id=tenant_id) except Exception as e: raise exception.EC2APIError(e) cidr_network = 'subnet-' + vpc_id for network in network_rsp['networks']: if network['name'] != cidr_network: continue try: subnets_rsp = neutron.list_subnets(network_id=network['id']) for subnet in subnets_rsp['subnets']: vpc_cidr = subnet['cidr'] except Exception as e: raise exception.EC2APIError(e) vpc_ip_block = IPNetwork(vpc_cidr) first_vpc_add = vpc_ip_block[0] last_vpc_add = vpc_ip_block[-1] first_subnet_add = subnet_ip_block[0] last_subnet_add = subnet_ip_block[-1] if first_subnet_add < first_vpc_add or \ last_subnet_add > last_vpc_add: msg = "subnet ip block not in vpc ip block" raise exception.InvalidParameterValue(err=msg) break # create network try: nw_name = 'subnet-' + ('%x' % uuid.uuid4().time_low) net_req = {'name': nw_name, 'tenant_id': tenant_id} net_rsp = neutron.create_network({'network': net_req}) except Exception as e: raise exception.EC2APIError(e) # set subnet for network subnet_req = {'network_id': net_rsp['network']['id'], 'cidr': unicode(cidr_block), 'ip_version': 4, 'tenant_id': tenant_id} try: neutron.create_subnet({'subnet': subnet_req}) except Exception as e: raise exception.EC2APIError(e) return {'subnet': {'subnetId': nw_name, 'state': 'available', 'vpcId': vpc_id, 'cidrBlock': cidr_block}} def delete_subnet(self, context, **kwargs): # delete VN for the passed subnet_id subnet_id = kwargs['subnet_id'] neutron = neutronv2.get_client(context) try: network_rsp = neutron.list_networks() except Exception as e: raise exception.EC2APIError(e) for network in network_rsp['networks']: if not network['name'].startswith('subnet-'): continue if network['name'] != subnet_id: continue try: subnets_rsp = neutron.list_subnets(network_id=network['id']) for subnet in subnets_rsp['subnets']: neutron.delete_subnet(subnet['id']) neutron.delete_network(network['id']) except Exception as e: raise exception.EC2APIError(e) return {'return': 'true'} def describe_subnets(self, context, **kwargs): # fetch tenant list try: kc = self._get_keystone_client(context) except kc.ClientException as e: raise exception.EC2APIError(e) # fetch network list neutron = neutronv2.get_client(context) try: network_rsp = neutron.list_networks() except Exception as e: raise exception.EC2APIError(e) # list of subnets/VNs subnets = [] for network in network_rsp['networks']: if not network['name'].startswith('subnet-'): continue if network['name'].startswith('subnet-vpc-'): continue cidr_block = network['contrail:subnet_ipam'][0]['subnet_cidr'] item = {'subnetId': network['name'], 'state': 'available', 'vpcId': network['contrail:fq_name'][1], 'cidrBlock': cidr_block} subnets.append(item) return {'subnetSet': subnets}

commit_message:

commit_message:
PXE and SSH validate() method to check for a port

The PXE and SSH server depends on a MACAddress to work, before the
validate() method of the PXE and SSH drivers didn't check whether the
node had a port associated with it or not making it possible to start
a provision/power state change without and address that would fail. So,
this patch is improving the validate() method of the PXE and SSH driver
to check for a port.

Closes-Bug: #1272045
Change-Id: I1e8deb91558478973b280ed25bf3b90da4e2b045
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/85/68985/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Task object as paramater to validate() methods

Add the task object as parameter to the validate() methods of the
driver interfaces. Some driver validation might need access to the other
resources apart from the node, e.g PXE and the SSH driver need to check
if the node has a port associated with it, because they need a MACAddress
to work (generate the config files, etc...)

Related-Bug: #1272045
Change-Id: I5cb311f89ea62c3b860f361cdf60251dd35e0245
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/80/68980/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
API validates driver name for both POST and PATCH

Change the RPCAPI get_topic_for method to raise a
NoValidHost exception when the driver is not found in the hash ring.

This allows the API to validate the driver before passing it either
to the dbapi (in POST) or to the conductor (in PATCH). In this way,
the error returned to the user is the same, and the error handling
is very similar in the code, when either creating or updating a node
and supplying a non-existing driver.

Change-Id: I392269882d9a58e1c682631c094d1ed387e45aa5
Closes-bug: #1238167

added_lines: from ironic.common import exception :raises: NoValidHost reason = _('Unknown driver %s.') % node.driver raise exception.NoValidHost(reason=reason)

commit_message:
network: add metering api operations

This patch aims to bring new tests related to Neutron Metering plugin.

They cover:
- List / Create / Show / Delete metering labels
- List / Create / Show / Delete metering label rules

Note: Update operation is not covered by the API.
Also add basic operations in network admin client.

Change-Id: Ieaf9a5dcd52f54e015e7565f50a3ea81569c483a
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/43/66143/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Clean up metering label rules for metering_label_rule in cls.metering_label_rules: cls.client.delete_metering_label_rule(metering_label_rule['id']) # Clean up metering labels for metering_label in cls.metering_labels: cls.client.delete_metering_label(metering_label['id']) def create_metering_label(cls, name, description): """Wrapper utility that returns a test metering label.""" resp, body = cls.client.create_metering_label( name=data_utils.rand_name("metering-label"), descrition=description) metering_label = body['metering_label'] cls.metering_labels.append(metering_label) return metering_label def create_metering_label_rule(cls, remote_ip_prefix, direction, metering_label_id): """Wrapper utility that returns a test metering label rule.""" resp, body = cls.client.create_metering_label_rule(remote_ip_prefix, direction, metering_label_id) metering_label_rule = body['metering_label_rule'] cls.metering_label_rules.append(metering_label_rule) return metering_label_rule

commit_message:
Fix test by waiting to lbaas entity delete

Adding a new timeout paramter in configuration
Reading the timeout paramter in test code.
Added a new function for waiting the timeout
calling the function when deleting vips and pools.

Change-Id: I45dce1c98328525745bc90019ff4e3d1cce6e367
Closes-Bug: #1271214

openstack/common/config/generator.py looks for a variable that is a list
of config options. The code in common.service was written with the list
passed as an argument to cfg.CONF.register_opts(), instead of being
assigned to a variable first, so the generator didn't detect it.

In common.service, the list of config options is now assigned to a variable.
The ironic.conf.sample file generated by tools/config/generate_sample.sh

Change-Id: I2f42e7f407ffc157d225652045c1bf53f65405b3
Closes-Bug: #1280064
"}]
commit_message:
Add common.service config options to sample

openstack/common/config/generator.py looks for a variable that is a list
of config options. The code in common.service was written with the list
passed as an argument to cfg.CONF.register_opts(), instead of being
assigned to a variable first, so the generator didn't detect it.

In common.service, the list of config options is now assigned to a variable.
The ironic.conf.sample file generated by tools/config/generate_sample.sh
now includes the two config options: periodic_interval and host.

Change-Id: I2f42e7f407ffc157d225652045c1bf53f65405b3
Closes-Bug: #1280064
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/88/73488/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

It is # not necessarily a hostname, FQDN, or IP address. commit_message:
Enable HDP 2 deployment leveraging HDP plugin

This commit introduces the ability to deploy HDP 2.0.6 clusters.
Both basic cluster provisioning functions (create, scale) as well
as EDP have been implemented.

There is some follow on work required to complete the integration:

- Topology/data locality support
- Verify cinder support
- Refactoring (there is ample opportunity for extracting parent
classes for common code, etc)

I have filed bug #1277653 to track these items.

Most of the items above were not undertaken as part of this commit in
an attempt to limit the scope/size of the commit as well to allow for
an iterative approach for achieving full functionality.

partially implements blueprint hdp-hdp2-support

Change-Id: I1cc483f05b65e1df0fb630d5e819ef23ab407492

commit_message:
Allow to tear-down a node waiting to be deployed

Introducing a new state, WAITDEPLOYING, those nodes which have failed
to POST and trigger the vendor_passthru._continue_deploy() can be
tear-down.

Closes-Bug: #1270986
Change-Id: Ib98f1ba6a29de46df9ce54941d0558df4f241f40

commit_message:
Always include network

There is a check in compute.rb for network_type, if 'nova' we
include openstack-compute::network, however, network.rb is also
where we load neutron plugins, and it also has a check for 'nova'
or 'neutron', so it doesn't make sense to not include this with
compute. Otherwise, if you assign this recipe to your compute node
and have 'openstack.compute.network.service_type=neutron' you
won't get your plugins (like openvswitch or nicira or whatnot)

Change-Id: I587ca1db3c7c0635121096dc0bb54f7caa30c784
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-compute refs/changes/38/72138/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix references to auth_token in middlewarearchitecture doc

The middlewarearchitecture doc was still referring to
keystone.middleware.auth_token, but the middleware was moved to
keystoneclient.

Also, corrected some other minor typos.

Change-Id: I270ea2ccc739596e99a4a852bff3b5b7d1c85c82

commit_message:
Handle API limit exception in OS::Trove::Instance

troveclient raises a RequestEntityTooLarge exception when an API limit
is encountered.  Previously, this would cause the stack action to fail.
Log a warning instead.

blueprint improve-api-polling

Change-Id: Ia7e5e321d5e1284880ee71fa0457be5726860aad

commit_message:
Removed useless prints that pollute tests log

We should not output any debug information during normal tests run.
Debug information should be printed only in case of test failures

Change-Id: Id361c453e9e14cf5a4e99a2eed837c52af4fa0e1

commit_message:
Refactor unnecessary arithmetic ops in periodic_task

Variables 'due' and 'now' are always used together by arithmetic operations.
Therefore it is redundant having individual variables defined.

Change-Id: I271cd6b5a1de80470380c70d66b99f584f7d8a87

added_lines: delta = due - time.time() if delta > 0.2: idle_for = min(idle_for, delta)
deleted_lines: now = time.time() if due > now + 0.2: idle_for = min(idle_for, due - now)

Add support retrying rest call in IDH plugin

If rest call returned connection error, retrying call

Fixes bug: #1280269

added_lines: from requests import exceptions as exc from savanna import context as ctxdef _check_response(fct): def wrapper(*args, **kwargs): resp = None error = True resp_count = 0 while error: error = False try: resp = fct(*args, **kwargs) except exc.ConnectionError as e: error = True LOG.debug("Request returned error '%s', retrying..." % str(e)) else: if 500 <= resp.status_code < 600: error = True LOG.debug("Request returned with code '%s' and reason " "'%s', retrying..." % ( resp.status_code, resp.reason)) if error: if resp_count > 10: break ctx.sleep(resp_count) resp_count += 1 else: break if resp: if not resp.ok: raise iex.IntelPluginException( "Request to manager returned with code '%s', reason '%s' " "and message '%s'" % (resp.status_code, resp.reason, json.loads(resp.text)['message'])) else: return json.loads(resp.text) else: raise iex.IntelPluginException( "Request to manager returned connection error") return wrapper @_check_response return requests.get(url, verify=False, auth=self.auth) @_check_response return requests.post(url, data=json.dumps(data) if data else None, verify=False, auth=self.auth, files=files) @_check_response return requests.delete(url, verify=False, auth=self.auth) @_check_response return r
deleted_lines: r = requests.get(url, verify=False, auth=self.auth) return self._check_response(r) r = requests.post(url, data=json.dumps(data) if data else None, verify=False, auth=self.auth, files=files) return self._check_response(r) r = requests.delete(url, verify=False, auth=self.auth) return self._check_response(r) return self._check_response(r) def _check_response(self, resp): LOG.debug("Response with HTTP code %s, and content of %s", resp.status_code, resp.text) if not resp.ok: raise iex.IntelPluginException( "Request to manager returned with code '%s', reason '%s' " "and message '%s'" % (resp.status_code, resp.reason, json.loads(resp.text)['message'])) else: return json.loads(resp.text)

commit_message:
Use the custom wsme BooleanType on the nodes api

Instead of using a wtypes.text on the boolean types in the api and then
having to convert it, this patch uses the custom wsme BooleanType to
make the validation for it.

Change-Id: I0165c31034185beb80e50d499cb0dc67b15e45dd

commit_message:
Add workaround for node['cpu']['total'] until fauxhai fix merges

- Set the node['cpu']['total'] value manually for each RUNNER
- This can be removed once https://github.com/customink/fauxhai/pull/77
  merges

Change-Id: Ie8e7eced230f89586c43f9637adae0c27ff95054
Partial-Bug: #1280309

commit_message:
Send email action, part 2

Added send_email to action types and action factory.
Now it works end-to-end.

NOTE:this renames DSL from action.parameters.responce
to action.output. Other projects will need to adjust.

Tested manually with mistral-extra/examples/webhooks/cmd/run.py,
It works, almost:  except a bug causing exception on parsing out results.
In discussion, but a fix should go in separate commit.

Also, small fixes:
action_factory:31 - used to blow up when action has no 'parameters'
dsl.py:32 - return details on parsing errors (error, line, column)
api/config.py - deleted: not used

Change-Id: Ie7079eb9589c23cc6704f8e8739af67a635f1c77
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/05/73205/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add wsme custom BooleanType type

This type can be used in the wsexpose decorator to validate boolean
types when the request comes in.

Change-Id: I9492e4c4c8c33335ff79129c58f05b15172b0aee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/79/73279/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class TestBooleanType(base.FunctionalTest): def test_valid_true_values(self): v = types.BooleanType() self.assertTrue(v.validate("true")) self.assertTrue(v.validate("TRUE")) self.assertTrue(v.validate("True")) self.assertTrue(v.validate("t")) self.assertTrue(v.validate("1")) self.assertTrue(v.validate("y")) self.assertTrue(v.validate("yes")) self.assertTrue(v.validate("on")) def test_valid_false_values(self): v = types.BooleanType() self.assertFalse(v.validate("false")) self.assertFalse(v.validate("FALSE")) self.assertFalse(v.validate("False")) self.assertFalse(v.validate("f")) self.assertFalse(v.validate("0")) self.assertFalse(v.validate("n")) self.assertFalse(v.validate("no")) self.assertFalse(v.validate("off")) def test_invalid_value(self): v = types.BooleanType() self.assertRaises(ValueError, v.validate, "invalid-value") self.assertRaises(ValueError, v.validate, "01")

commit_message:
Re-use qpid's heartbeat to configure max delay

Instead of adding a new configuration option, or changing the current
algorithm, this patch proposes to re-use current qpid's heartbeat option
to configure the maximum time qpid's reconnection could wait.

Closes-bug: #1281148

Change-Id: Ie2b42365f6aabe3e6c1a0d331b765bdf0f253572
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/87/74087/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: delay = min(2 * delay, self.qpid_heartbeat)

commit_message:
Re-use qpid's heartbeat to configure max delay

Instead of adding a new configuration option, or changing the current
algorithm, this patch proposes to re-use current qpid's heartbeat option
to configure the maximum time qpid's reconnection could wait.

Change-Id: Ie2b42365f6aabe3e6c1a0d331b765bdf0f253572
Closes-bug: #1281148

commit_message:
Get instance networking information from Neutron

project/instances, admin/instances and the instance details page
all get networking information from Nova. However, with Neutron
enabled, floating IP associations are done direcly with Neutron,
meaning that Nova's DB will fall out of sync and thus the GUI
won't reflect successful floating IP associations until Nova
polls Neutron again and updates its DB. The polling can take
up to several minutes to complete for consecutive floating IP
operations.

The solution is to update instances' networking information from
Neutron immediately after the call to list Nova instances.

Closes-Bug: #1265032
Change-Id: I0382fa9a4a9fff21e7b4d05cd3b76783f826735f

This patch allows to quickly create the server to subscribe to
notification messages. It only supports the messaging driver.

The implementation:
- allows to create a server that dispatch notification message to the
  method process_notification of the first matching endpoints.
- allows to configure the target to not automatically
acknowledge the notification message.

Example of the api:

class Endpoint(object):
    def process_notification(self, notification):
        do_somehting(notification.message)
        notfication.acknowledge()

target = messaging.Target(topic='notification.info', exchange='cinder',
                          server='ceilometerhost', no_ack=True)
server = notify.get_subscriber_server(transport, target, endpoints)

Implements bp/notification-subscriber-server

commit_message:
Implements notification listener and dispatcher

This patch allows to quickly create a listener to receive
notification messages.

Example of the api:

class Endpoint(object):
    def warn(self, ctxt, publisher_id, event_type, payload):
        do_something(payload)

target = messaging.Target(topic='notifications', exchange='cinder')
listener = notify.get_notification_listener(transport, [target],
                                            [Endpoint()],
                                            executor,
                                            serializer)

Implements blueprint notification-subscriber-server

Change-Id: I434bc487c382a2048670df726d9bebd640150bb9

You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import logging from oslo.messaging import server as msg_server _LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class NoSuchMethod(msg_server.MessagingServerError, AttributeError): "Raised if there is no endpoint which exposes the requested method." def __init__(self, method): msg = "Endpoint does not support Notification method %s" % method super(NoSuchMethod, self).__init__(msg) self.method = method class NotificationDispatcher(object): """A message dispatcher which understands Notification messages. A MessageHandlingServer is constructed by passing a callable dispatcher which is invoked with context and message dictionaries each time a message is received. NotifcationDispatcher is one such dispatcher which pass a raw notification message to the endpoints """ def __init__(self, endpoints, method='process_notification'): self.endpoints = endpoints self.method = method def __call__(self, message): """Dispatch an RPC message to the appropriate endpoint method. :param message: the raw notification message :type message: dict :raises: NoSuchMethod """ for endpoint in self.endpoints: if hasattr(endpoint, self.method): return getattr(endpoint, self.method)(message) raise NoSuchMethod(self.method) def get_subscriber_server(transport, target, endpoints, executor='blocking'): """Construct a notify server. The executor parameter controls how incoming messages will be received and dispatched. By default, the most simple executor is used - the blocking executor. :param transport: the messaging transport :type transport: Transport :param target: the exchange, topic and server to listen on :type target: Target :param endpoints: a list of endpoint objects :type endpoints: list :param executor: name of a message executor - e.g. 'eventlet', 'blocking' :type executor: str """ dispatcher = NotificationDispatcher(endpoints) return msg_server.MessageHandlingServer(transport, target, dispatcher, executor, raw_mode=True)

commit_message:
admin-guide-cloud: Document Neutron Metering Agent

Neutron Metering Agent has been introduced in Havana release.
This patch adds the agent in Neutron Diagram and explains the process to
install the agent on the network nodes.

Change-Id: Id8f16aab44af18141a63fa873d9f856f83f444a4
backport: havana
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>

commit_message:
Merge same db calls for some quota methods

self.db.quota_get_all_by_project is called twice in method limit_check()
and reserve(),
self.db.quota_get_all_by_project_and_user is called twice in method
get_settable_quotas()

Change-Id: Ibe41f49afe16c220ca663a7ad13b61acc08c7775
Closes-bug: 1277068

Add cliff, pycadf, stevedore, & taskflow from oslo

Oslo has adopted 4 libraries that were previously on
stackforge, so we can now install them from source.

commit_message:
Add auth_uri option

'Configuring auth_uri to point to the public identity endpoint is
required; clients may not be able to authenticate against an admin
endpoint.' If auth_uri is not set, such warning will be logged.

Closes-Bug: #1279730

commit_message:
Support reviewers stats for stable branches

Adds a "-s" option that lets you specify the name of a stable branch
(for example "-s havana") instead of specifying a project (-p) or all
projects (-a).

reviewers.py will then use a specific stable.json file that defines the
set of projects stable-maint-core has authority on, as well as the
contents of that core team.

Note: -s disables result caching since the search is made on
specific branches, which would pollute the general purpose cache.

Change-Id: Idd03f51c98e006972bc93e3ce11e052cd1cc26aa

commit_message:
allow overriding all endpoint hosts with a single attribute

similar to the pattern in the messaging and database attributes, this is
a convenience change that allows you to set all endpoint host values to
something other than the default of 127.0.0.1, by only overriding a
single attribute in your environment.

Quite often one will want to set all endpoints to the same IP, for
example in the case where you are deploying a 'controller' node, and at
the moment every endpoint host attribute has to be overridden
individually.

All endpoint host attributes can still be overridden individually if
desired.

Change-Id: I7dd96f69c3eaa9156513663f08dafbddf1c1ffd8

commit_message:
Show error in login page in Unauthorized exception

When user hits an 'Unauthorized' exception, redirect to login page,
and show error in popup message.

This is a follow up fix for problem in:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/24604

Above fix changed Horzon to popup error message instead of redirect
to login page, in order to provide user error details. However,
this behavior may send exception page to user directly, because
there are lots of unhandled 'Unauthorized' exception in Horizon.

This fix changes back to the old style of behavior that redirect
to login page, and show the actual error in popup message.

Change-Id: I26d5fe60ecca6c104f948f70717976e07f0f2009
Closes-Bug: #1252785

subject: VMware: fix exception when using multiple compute nodes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-26 17:00:56.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/d46f4a5b6d17f20a9c1de9367af11c9f3e7a7ef0', 'message': 'VMware: fix exception when using multiple compute nodes

When there is more than one compute node running and one of the
nodes restarts it terminates on an exception that the resource is

The cause of the issue is that a vif plug was being attempted for
a resource that did not exist. The vif plug should have raised an

Change-Id: I5a3f1cc73a981173b6c2fa493de3aad10a7e97fd
Closes-bug: #1272286

commit_message:
VMware: fix exception when using multiple compute nodes

When there is more than one compute node running and one of the
nodes restarts it terminates on an exception that the resource is
not found.

The cause of the issue is that a vif plug was being attempted for
a resource that did not exist. The vif plug should have raised an
"NotImplemented" exception.

Change-Id: I5a3f1cc73a981173b6c2fa493de3aad10a7e97fd
Closes-bug: #1272286

commit_message:
Fix openSUSE dashboard file locations

The openstack packaging has been changed so that the horizon packages
are now in /srv. Update all occurences.

Not backported: doc/admin-guide-cloud/ch_compute.xml

Change-Id: Ib53c7ba7396e7f99433068d7a4625b12bd918957
Closes-Bug: #1279892
backport: havana
(cherry picked from commit cdbf99aa92e4d60e410768ef86016f431b56186c)

commit_message:
Allow concat fw-admin w/ other nets in serializer

For Neutron mode an orchestrator_serialiser does:
* Create a bridge 'br-fw-admin'
* Connect it to node.admin_interface
* It's allowed to connect other nets to node.admin_interface
* In GRE mode the bridge 'br-prv' is not created.
* Change an order of bridge creation to manadge right
  ordering of IP setup.
* Revert qickfixed changes in logic https://review.openstack.org/#/c/72563
* Revert qickfixed changes in verifying https://review.openstack.org/#/c/72606

Closes-bug: 1278363
Change-Id: I5a9036c61cdd0099a25cfc6c153f48d7f3e56876
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/26/72326/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Skip a test for nicira service plugin

test_router_add_interface_subnet_with_port_from_other_tenant
is causing intermittent failures in unit tests because of
issues related with sql session autoflush.

This patch skips this test, since it is already covered
by another test case in the same module. This should prevent
job failures while the relevant bug is addressed.

Change-Id: Iad33dada61d17fad14e569e241f4079465b5f792
Related-Bug: 1280035
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/32/73832/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_router_add_interface_subnet_with_port_from_other_tenant(self): self.skip("Skipping this unit test until bug 1280035 is fixed")

commit_message:
Fix swift data source credential validation

The validation for swift data source credentials assumed that only the
elements within the credentials were missing. If the credentials
element itself was missing an internal error would be triggered.

Change-Id: I1c5d9673ae383eb8154508be01ceb67877b6e0cb
Closes-bug: #1277497

commit_message:
Add action_event_create and action_event_update api to conductor

This is the first one of patch series to support recording more event
details in action events. The current action_event_start /
action_event_finish functions always called in pair and lacks of
flexibility in order to inject a single event entry for debugging
purpose.

This patch preserves current action_event_start / action_event_finish
interface and behavior for compatiblity sake. The action_event_create
behaves just like action_event_start, however this function call doesn't
implicitly imply a subsequent 'finish' calls. And it can be used to
inject a one-shot entry for event record.

Implement: blueprint improve-instance-action-events
Change-Id: I82cdf9bea07ba4e39b54ff99946abbd3ec09bff6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/50/61050/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _action_event_create(context, values):def action_event_start(context, values): """Start an event on an instance action.""" convert_datetimes(values, 'start_time') return _action_event_create(context, values) def action_event_create(context, values): """Create an event entry on an instance action.""" convert_datetimes(values, 'start_time', 'finish_time') return _action_event_create(context, values) def _action_event_update(context, values, **kwargs): query = model_query(context, models.InstanceActionEvent, session=session).\ filter_by(event=values['event']) event_id = kwargs.get('event_id', None) if event_id: query = query.filter_by(id=event_id) event_ref = query.first()def action_event_finish(context, values): """Finish an event on an instance action.""" return _action_event_update(context, values) def action_event_update(context, event_id, values): """Update an event entry on an instance action.""" filter_kwargs = {'event_id': event_id} return _action_event_update(context, values, **filter_kwargs)
deleted_lines: def action_event_start(context, values): """Start an event on an instance action.""" convert_datetimes(values, 'start_time')def action_event_finish(context, values): """Finish an event on an instance action.""" event_ref = model_query(context, models.InstanceActionEvent, session=session).\ filter_by(event=values['event']).\ first()

commit_message:
Set sensible default for keystone's paste

The https://review.openstack.org/#/c/66247/ change introduced
the requirement to set config_file before keystone would start
up. Restore the old setting as default to allow a smooth
transition for users.

Change-Id: I935c5144728d04c59abaee9a515e249ef0d24477

commit_message:
provide designate getting started instructions for Fedora 19

Provide a Fedora 19 section in the Getting Started guide to highlight
the differences between Ubuntu and Fedora 19.

Change-Id: I0998bd7b923713a43701ec4ad39fe5a008291c58
Closes-Bug: #1270317
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/98/67598/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: For this guide you will need access to an Ubuntu Server (12.04). Other platforms: - `Fedora 19 Notes`_Fedora 19 Notes =============== Most of the above instructions under `Installing Designate`_ should work. There are a few differences when working with Fedora 19: The basic Fedora packages are **python-pip python-virtualenv python-pbr rabbitmq-server** :: $ yum install python-pip python-virtualenv python-pbr rabbitmq-server Use **/var/lib/designate** as the root path for databases and other variable state files, not /root/designate :: $ mkdir -p /var/lib/designate The PowerDNS Fedora packages are **pdns pdns-backend-sqlite** :: $ yum install pdns pdns-backend-sqlite Fedora 19 does not use /etc/powerdns/pdns.d. Instead, edit **/etc/pdns/pdns.conf** - change the launch option, and add a gsqlite3-database option :: ... setuid=pdns setgid=pdns launch=gsqlite3 gsqlite3-database=/var/lib/designate/pdns.sqlite ... Fedora uses **systemctl**, not service :: $ systemctl [start|restart|stop|status] pdns.service $ systemctl [start|restart|stop|status] rabbitmq-server.service The rabbitmq service must be running before doing :: $ rabbitmqctl change_password guest guest RabbitMQ may fail to start due to SELinux. Use *journalctl -xn|cat* to find the error. You will likely have to do something like this until it is added to the SELinux base policy :: $ yum install /usr/bin/checkpolicy $ grep beam /var/log/audit/audit.log|audit2allow -M mypol $ semodule -i mypol.pp $ systemctl start rabbitmq-server.service The rabbitmq log files are in **/var/log/rabbitmq**
deleted_lines: For this guide you will need access to an Ubuntu Server (12.04).

commit_message:
Add a new ExtensionPlugin class

This plugin type allows for loading multiple plugins of the same
type, and the Notification Handlers have been updated to make use
of this class.

Change-Id: I7bd46a30f1b153cc6adce18fec8bbd25e9fa1aa8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/17/72317/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from stevedore import enabled class ExtensionPlugin(Plugin): @classmethod def get_extensions(cls, enabled_extensions=None): """ Load a series of extensions """ def _check_func(ext): if enabled_extensions is None: # All extensions are enabled by default, if no specific list # is specified return True return ext.plugin.get_plugin_name() in enabled_extensions mgr = enabled.EnabledExtensionManager( cls.__plugin_ns__, check_func=_check_func, propagate_map_exceptions=True) return [e.plugin for e in mgr]

commit_message:
Use six.moves.urllib.parse instead of urlparse

To keep Python 3.x compatibility, use six.moves.urllib.parse
to replace urlparse.

Change-Id: Ib82f1f5108e4ec4f420f7a4745ab968df409c11d

commit_message:
Fix submit button in overview

Go to Admin -> Overview, or Project -> Overview select a date,
and click "Submit" button,then the "Submit" button is disabled,
but the Usage info below doesn't seem to respond to the new date
range accordingly.

Change-Id: I50466d748884c3b327a2517d5d1136137b5259f6
Closes-Bug:#1270977

commit_message:
Add Unit Tests for Blacklists V2

Adding the v2 unit tests for the new Blacklists API call.

Change-Id: I0362cbdb342bc7bd562e769e76af26435b80c888
Implements: blueprint blacklist-v2-unit-tests
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/85/73685/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2014 Rackspace Hosting # All rights reserved # # Author: Betsy Luzader <betsy.luzader@rackspace.com> # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from designate.tests.test_api.test_v2 import ApiV2TestCase class ApiV2BlacklistsTest(ApiV2TestCase): def setUp(self): super(ApiV2BlacklistsTest, self).setUp() def test_get_blacklists(self): # Set the policy file as this is an admin-only API self.policy({'find_blacklists': '@'}) response = self.client.get('/blacklists/') # Check the headers are what we expect self.assertEqual(200, response.status_int) self.assertEqual('application/json', response.content_type) # Check the body structure is what we expect self.assertIn('blacklists', response.json) self.assertIn('links', response.json) self.assertIn('self', response.json['links']) # Test with 0 blacklists self.assertEqual(0, len(response.json['blacklists'])) # Test with 1 blacklist self.create_blacklist(fixture=0) response = self.client.get('/blacklists/') self.assertIn('blacklists', response.json) self.assertEqual(1, len(response.json['blacklists'])) # test with 2 blacklists self.create_blacklist(fixture=1) response = self.client.get('/blacklists/') self.assertIn('blacklists', response.json) self.assertEqual(2, len(response.json['blacklists'])) def test_get_blacklist(self): blacklist = self.create_blacklist(fixture=0) # Set the policy file as this is an admin-only API self.policy({'find_blacklist': '@'}) response = self.client.get('/blacklists/%s' % blacklist['id'], headers=[('Accept', 'application/json')]) # Verify the headers self.assertEqual(200, response.status_int) self.assertEqual('application/json', response.content_type) # Verify the body structure self.assertIn('blacklist', response.json) self.assertIn('links', response.json['blacklist']) self.assertIn('self', response.json['blacklist']['links']) # Verify the returned values self.assertIn('id', response.json['blacklist']) self.assertIn('created_at', response.json['blacklist']) self.assertIsNone(response.json['blacklist']['updated_at']) self.assertEqual(self.get_blacklist_fixture(0)['pattern'], response.json['blacklist']['pattern']) def test_create_blacklist(self): self.policy({'create_blacklist': '@'}) fixture = self.get_blacklist_fixture(0) response = self.client.post_json('/blacklists/', {'blacklist': fixture}) # Verify the headers self.assertEqual(201, response.status_int) self.assertEqual('application/json', response.content_type) # Verify the body structure self.assertIn('blacklist', response.json) self.assertIn('links', response.json['blacklist']) self.assertIn('self', response.json['blacklist']['links']) # Verify the returned values self.assertIn('id', response.json['blacklist']) self.assertIn('created_at', response.json['blacklist']) self.assertIsNone(response.json['blacklist']['updated_at']) self.assertEqual(fixture['pattern'], response.json['blacklist']['pattern']) def test_delete_blacklist(self): blacklist = self.create_blacklist(fixture=0) self.policy({'delete_blacklist': '@'}) self.client.delete('/blacklists/%s' % blacklist['id'], status=204) def test_update_blacklist(self): blacklist = self.create_blacklist(fixture=0) self.policy({'update_blacklist': '@'}) # Prepare the update body body = {'blacklist': {'description': 'prefix-%s' % blacklist['description']}} response = self.client.patch_json('/blacklists/%s' % blacklist['id'], body, status=200) # Verify the headers self.assertEqual(200, response.status_int) self.assertEqual('application/json', response.content_type) # Verify the body structure self.assertIn('blacklist', response.json) self.assertIn('links', response.json['blacklist']) self.assertIn('self', response.json['blacklist']['links']) # Verify the returned values self.assertIn('id', response.json['blacklist']) self.assertIsNotNone(response.json['blacklist']['updated_at']) self.assertEqual('prefix-%s' % blacklist['description'], response.json['blacklist']['description'])

commit_message:
Remove using of deprecated self.headers (part1)

Attr self.headers in rest client is deprecated now, and
should be removed from usage by service clients.

This patch removes first bunch of attrs.
Second and last part is intended to be in another patch,
with removing from all other service clients
and from rest client itself.

Change-Id: I28981738a9e7f39343cf530c2642315f0a5b22f2
Partially-implements: bp refactor-rest-client

commit_message:
Add a version API test for Nova v2 API

The version API of Nova returns the API version information with the
following body:

  {"version":
    {"status": "CURRENT",
     "updated": "2011-01-21T11:33:21Z",
     "id": "v2.0",
     ..
    }
  }

This patch adds the API test.

Change-Id: I1c87dd7515ee0574c40059d15b617851386a9ec7

added_lines: # Copyright 2014 NEC Corporation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from lxml import etree from tempest.common import rest_client from tempest.services.compute.xml import common class VersionClientXML(rest_client.RestClientXML): def __init__(self, config, username, password, auth_url, tenant_name=None): super(VersionClientXML, self).__init__(config, username, password, auth_url, tenant_name) self.service = self.config.compute.catalog_type def _parse_array(self, node): json = common.xml_to_json(node) return json def get_version(self): resp, body = self.get('', self.headers) body = self._parse_array(etree.fromstring(body)) return resp, body

commit_message:
port nova v2 images related tests into nova v3 part2

In nova v3 api, there is no image api. So in nova v3
api tests, we just keep these tests related to create_image
action of the server api. Other tests are moved into glance
testing, also some tests is no longer available, as some
actions are just nova v2 api for glance proxy behaviour.
eg: update the specified item of image properties. In glance
we can only  update all values of image properties.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api-tests

Change-Id: I89cec53f30f607b39ff2b4762d35c0f307cc634b

commit_message:
Use cStringIO from six.moves instead of cStringIO

use cStingIO from six to improve python3 compatible

Change-Id: I727875761a9b94be69345c8459ed0cbaa0485dd4
Closes-Bug:#1280964
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/26/74026/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from six.moves import cStringIO buff = cStringIO()
deleted_lines: import cStringIO as StringIO buff = StringIO.StringIO()

subject: New SSL extension
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-20 20:33:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/d9fee96faec96b0452b5e9176cf609f1c0aa0313', 'message': "New SSL extension

Adding new ssl extension for ssl-termination support
in neutron.

Adding new extension and db mixin for ssl policies and certificates
management

Adding new plugin api for ssl policies, cetrificates
and trusted certificates associating with vip

Adding new functions to common utils which translate
single entity name to plural entity name and vise versa.
Using new util functions in plugin instead of adding 's'
to get plural entity name

Adding tests for new common utils functions

Modifying existing tests to fit new extension

Adding new ssl api to all drivers (not implemented)

Change-Id: Ie96ebe3f35384468b8eab3b218238c8a1be92437
Implements: blueprint lbaas-ssl-termination
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-24 14:48:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/0beab34928d4520435ec56e7d29937bc79843622', 'message': 'New SSL extension

'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-15 17:25:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/c52b57c49f3b4dd13789cade119ebf6e022cc214', 'message': 'New SSL extension

Adding new ssl extension for ssl-termination support
in neutron.
Extension is not served by lbaas plugin
but is extending lbaas vip with ssl entities associations

Creating new abstract driver for ssl api
Adding new absract driver as a base to radware driver

Adding ssl dbmixin for ssl policies and certificates
management. Mixin is serving as an extension plugin.
Drivers are loaded similar to lbaas plugin.
If service provider (driver) is not inheriting from new
abstract ssl driver - new "ExtensionNotSupportedByProvider"
exception is raised

Change-Id: Ie96ebe3f35384468b8eab3b218238c8a1be92437
Implements: blueprint lbaas-ssl-termination
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-22 11:56:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/d5e60748a9a40baa94de38bcb5fe55fad2d30137', 'message': 'New SSL extension

Adding new ssl extension for ssl-termination support
in neutron.
Extension is not served by lbaas plugin
but is extending lbaas vip with ssl entities associations

Creating new abstract driver for ssl api
Adding new absract driver as a base to radware driver

Adding ssl dbmixin for ssl policies and certificates
management. Mixin is serving as an extension plugin.
Drivers are loaded similar to lbaas plugin.
If service provider (driver) is not inheriting from new
abstract ssl driver - new "ExtensionNotSupportedByProvider"
exception is raised.

Since association of ssl certificates and vip requires
sending a list on certificates, list support was needed
in neutron resource attributes parsing mechanism.
I added the lists support and extended unit tests to test it.

Change-Id: Ie96ebe3f35384468b8eab3b218238c8a1be92437
Implements: blueprint lbaas-ssl-termination

commit_message:
New SSL extension

Adding new ssl extension for ssl-termination support
in neutron.
Extension is not served by lbaas plugin
but is extending lbaas vip with ssl entities associations

Creating new abstract driver for ssl api
Adding new absract driver as a base to radware driver

Adding ssl dbmixin for ssl policies and certificates
management.
If service provider (driver) is not inheriting from new
abstract ssl driver - new "ExtensionNotSupportedByProvider"
exception is raised.

Since association of ssl certificates and vip requires
sending a list on certificates, list support was needed
in neutron resource attributes parsing mechanism.
I added the lists support and extended unit tests to test it.

Added unit tests for extension and db mixin
Those tests flood up bug in other test
(tests/unit/test_extension_ext_gw_mode.TestL3GwModeMixin)
Bug #1279742 was opened for the issue.
Bug is fixed as part of this patch.

Change-Id: Ie96ebe3f35384468b8eab3b218238c8a1be92437
Implements: blueprint lbaas-ssl-termination

commit_message:
Only run the syncdb when set the session backend to sql.

From the horizon manual
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/horizon/topics/deployment.html#database,
we need the database only when set the session backend to sql, so we
just need run syncdb at that case.
Another reason I don't want to run this syncdb is, normally the web
application (here is the horizon) should not access the database server
directly in data center for security consideration.

Change-Id: I39323fc797bcb9a9b821e955d8f648a4271086b1
