commit_message:
Count memory and disk slots once in cells state manager

If multiple instance types in a cell had the same memory_mb value or
root_gb + ephemeral_gb added to the same value, then capacity counts
would be inaccurate since slots would get counted multiple times.
Rather than counting based on instance type it is now based on the set
of memory or disk values pulled from instance types.

Change-Id: Iaded7fa69dadb4aa0335ef1569975bdfcb2767c6
Closes-bug: #1276728

commit_message:
Flavor show api will not show deleted flavors

* Do not show deleted flavors for flavor show api call
* Return deleted flavor details with v3 server show api call
* Not showing deleted flavors because flavor id are not unique
  for deleted/non-deleted flavors and this can return duplicates during
  "nova show"/ server show api call

Closes-Bug: #1153926
Change-Id: Ia38a6ad64f2c216b50c5a955a4f3f6d66f6424da

commit_message:
Use six.moves.urllib.parse instead of urlparse

To keep Python 3.x compatibility, use six.moves.urllib.parse to
replace urlparse.

Change-Id: I81333ca4d6ed88b2d491657170f526cbe9671d1f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/90/72590/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Change 'update default quotas' success and failure messages

Success and failure messages include formatting that adds name,
which makes for awkward phrasing when displayed to the user.
Removed formatting to clarify message text for both success and
failure messages.

Change-Id: Id754ec9cb132ba82c07c13b05c76367739d3faaf
Closes-Bug: #1274654

deleted_lines: success_message = _('Default quotas updated "%s".') failure_message = _('Unable to update default quotas "%s".')

commit_message:
Make object upload success message translatable.

Since the corresponding request is not ajax, we should
use "force_unicode" to translate the message.

Closes-Bug: #1252089

Change-Id: I76098a0d4b51c5f479deca01cbd3702989a5f162
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/28/72328/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from django.utils.encoding import force_unicode msg = force_unicode(_("Object was successfully uploaded.")) messages.success(request, msg)

commit_message:
Fix metering service endpoint path

After installing ceilometer with the metering cookbook, invoking the
ceilometer CLI fails because the API base URL used is
http://127.0.0.1:8777/v1/v2 which means that the base endpoint path of
/v1 is incorrect and it should be simply /.

Change-Id: Id65a17a888175c7b2fe2d3171147cedb66921cc9
Partial-Bug: #1277742

commit_message:
Unneeded identity reg done for api-cfn

When the heat cloud formation (api-cfn recipe) is not needed and
not used, the identity recipe still creates service and endpoint
identity registrations for it. I added a check to see if the
api-cfn recipe is in the run_list, suggestions welcome for better
ways to approach this.

Change-Id: I5f326a66f005f0553aecd8cea798a224d76f57c4
Closes-bug: 1279577

added_lines: You can manage OpenStack Networking services using the service command. For enabling them to build rich network topologies. Networking API directly or the Networking command-line interface (CLI). The Networking CLI is a wrapper around corresponding Networking command. both L2 network topologies and their allocated IP addresses (IP Address Management or IPAM). There is also an extension to cover basic L3 forwarding and NAT, which provides capabilities and other network configuration, such as default gateways or dns-servers, with an Networking network. Each subnet represents an IPv4 or IPv6 address block, and each Networking network can have multiple subnets. commit_message:
Added recommendation for reserved_host_memory_mb value

The default for reserved_host_memory_mb is 512 MB but because the
vCenter driver reports memory available to the VMs, VMware suggests
setting this value to 0 MB. Added this recommendation to the
 VMwareVCDriver configuration options section

Change-Id: I11e01ff36a4d91c2c268b2ece65b4e7e19990468
Closes-Bug: #1267303

added_lines: Data stores: The datastore_regex setting specifies the data stores to use with Compute. For example, datastore_regex="nas.*" selects all the data stores that have a name starting with "nas". If this line is omitted, Compute uses the first data store returned by the vSphere API. It is Reserved host memory: the reserved_host_memory_mb setting is set to 512 MB by default. However, VMware recommends setting this value to 0 MB because the vCenter driver reports the effective memory available to the virtual machines.

commit_message:
Create publishdocs target for publishing

tox -e publishdocs will be called by the post jenkins jobs to prepare
everything for publishing - and then the content of publish-docs
gets copied.

Change-Id: Ic6540fd279549e082ccc0abd60623b553e798f1d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/19/73619/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [testenv:publishdocs] # Prepare all documents (except www subdir) so that they can get # published on docs.openstack.org with just copying publish-docs/* # over. commands = openstack-doc-test --check-build --nocreate-index --force

commit_message:
XenAPI: Report the CPU details correctly

Driver was not filling in the cpu_count in the correct field.
Also added VM vcpu count

Change-Id: I6339d7fd4faffcd5320fd86b55ff3a5e3515e2bf
Closes-bug: 1192528

commit_message:
fix ips to 'ips' in APIRouter

Actually ips in `ips in init_only` would not be valued as True because
ips is a moudle object not a string. Fixing this to string 'ips' could
prevent potential issues and improve readability.

Change-Id: I74564349e1fef00e7430cfb0547b3ad87c8e471c

commit_message:
Adding first_address attribute for port resource

This patch give availability for getting fixed ip address easily.

Closes-bug: #1262196

Change-Id: I08f6b83e7bb990d6ca8f5cd4c6114bbae038c535
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/36/67836/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_resolve_first_address_attribute(self): clients.OpenStackClients.keystone().AndReturn( fakes.FakeKeystoneClient()) neutronclient.Client.create_port({'port': { 'network_id': u'net1234', 'name': utils.PhysName('test_stack', 'port'), 'security_groups': [], 'fixed_ips': [{ 'subnet_id': u'sub1234', 'ip_address': u'10.0.3.21' }], 'admin_state_up': True}} ).AndReturn({'port': { "status": "BUILD", "id": "fc68ea2c-b60b-4b4f-bd82-94ec81110766" }}) neutronclient.Client.show_port( 'fc68ea2c-b60b-4b4f-bd82-94ec81110766' ).AndReturn({'port': { "status": "ACTIVE", "id": "fc68ea2c-b60b-4b4f-bd82-94ec81110766" }}) self.m.ReplayAll() t = template_format.parse(neutron_port_template) stack = utils.parse_stack(t) port = stack['port'] scheduler.TaskRunner(port.create)() self.assertEqual('10.0.3.21', port.FnGetAtt('first_address')) self.m.VerifyAll() def test_resolve_empty_first_address_attribute(self): clients.OpenStackClients.keystone().AndReturn( fakes.FakeKeystoneClient()) neutronclient.Client.create_port({'port': { 'network_id': u'net1234', 'name': utils.PhysName('test_stack', 'port'), 'security_groups': [], 'fixed_ips': [], 'admin_state_up': True}} ).AndReturn({'port': { "status": "BUILD", "id": "fc68ea2c-b60b-4b4f-bd82-94ec81110766" }}) neutronclient.Client.show_port( 'fc68ea2c-b60b-4b4f-bd82-94ec81110766' ).AndReturn({'port': { "status": "ACTIVE", "id": "fc68ea2c-b60b-4b4f-bd82-94ec81110766" }}) self.m.ReplayAll() t = template_format.parse(neutron_port_template) t['Resources']['port']['Properties'].pop('fixed_ips') stack = utils.parse_stack(t) port = stack['port'] scheduler.TaskRunner(port.create)() self.assertEqual('', port.FnGetAtt('first_address')) self.m.VerifyAll()

commit_message:
WIP: Enable H302 rule

DO NOT MERGE because this is 'work in progress'.

This commit is just enabling H302 rule. We may take a long time for
correcting all files . So this can check the status of the resolving
H302 violation.

Change-Id: Id2c393e225f815719bb2fa6f7ae49256b2bda837

Closes-Bug: #1243332

added_lines: I want to run benchmarks on three new machines ----------------------------------------------- There are four machines, 3 OSD, 1 MON and one machine that is the client from which the user runs commands. install puppetmaster and create site.pp with: /ceph-default/ { class { 'ceph::conf': auth_enable => false, mon_host => 'node1' }; } /node1/ inherits ceph-default { ceph::mon { $hostname: }; ceph::osd { 'discover': }; } /node2/, /node3/ inherits ceph-default { ceph::osd { 'discover': }; } /client/ inherits ceph-default { class { 'ceph::client' }; } * ssh client * rados bench * interpret the results

commit_message:
Fix misspellings in openstack-doc-tools

Fix misspellings detected by:
* pip install misspellings
* git ls-files | grep -v locale | misspellings -f -

Change-Id: Ia6fa0ca03cd7c1d17f75cc349f9dba56e93f56b2
Closes-Bug: #1257295

Co-Author: Yassine Lamgarchal <yassine.lamgarchal@enovance.com>

Change-Id: I6a919bdab6c5ca472b331b8ac76284925a5664f2
Implements part of bp validate-targethost-live-migration
'}]
commit_message:
Store scheduler_hints in instance_system_metadata when create instance

Store scheduler_hints in instance_system_metadata when create instance,
the scheduler_hints can be later used by live migration or evacuate for
host validation.

Co-Author: Yassine Lamgarchal <yassine.lamgarchal@enovance.com>

Change-Id: I6a919bdab6c5ca472b331b8ac76284925a5664f2
Implements part of bp validate-targethost-live-migration

commit_message:
implements:bp/fsl-sdn-os-mech-driver::fsl mech driver

Freescale SDN Mechanism Driver to support CRD service

A new directory 'freescale' is created to hold the code in
ml2/drivers.

The following new files were added:

neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/freescale/README : README for driver
neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/freescale/__init__.py
neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/freescale/client.py : CRD helper class for use in driver.
neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/freescale/mech_fslsdn.py: FSl SDN ML2 Driver

The following files are modified:

neutron/tests/unit/ml2/drivers/test_fslsdn_mech.py: updated 'import' path with new file path

Change-Id: I091d51b68f5d07e64e553638b3bb070462dd077b

commit_message:
Support peer discovery through the metadata service

Adds an endpoint to the openstack metadata service to support peer discovery.
A GET on http://169.254.169.254/openstack/latest/peers.json returns a JSON
list of instances in the same project. This can be used to seed a node list
for a gossip protocol.

Change-Id: I76c912e7cd6c417b042567a55fb5869f5a22608e
Implements: blueprint first-discover-your-peers
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/25/68825/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

'8cbd0080-bdb0-4714-8322-9370c9249851', 'qbg_params': None, 'ovs_interfaceid': None, 'network': {'bridge': 'br100', 'subnets': [ {'ips': [ {'meta': {}, 'version': 4, 'type': 'fixed', 'floating_ips': '10.11.12.0/24', 'gateway': {'meta': {}, 'version': 4, 'type': 'gateway', 'address': '10.11.12.1' } }, { 'ips': [], 'version': None, 'meta': {'dhcp_server': None}, 'dns': [], 'routes': [], 'cidr': None, 'gateway': {'meta': {}, 'version': None, 'type': 'gateway', 'address': None } } ], 'meta': {'tenant_id': None, 'should_create_bridge': True, 'bridge_interface': 'eth0' }, 'id': 'f2940cd1-f382-4163-a18f-c8f937c99157', 'label': 'private' }, }] vd_driver=None, network_info=None, conductor_api=None): vd_driver=vd_driver, network_info=network_info, conductor_api=conductor_api) def test_peers(self): def build_peer_conductor_data(i): return fake_instance.fake_db_instance(** {'id': i, 'availability_zone': 'zone' + str(i), 'uuid': 'b65cee2f-8c69-4aeb-be2f-f79742548fc' + str(i), 'name': 'fake' + str(i), 'project_id': 'test', 'reservation_id': 'r-xxxxxxxx', 'security_groups': [{'name': 'sg' + str(i)}], 'info_cache': { 'network_info': json.dumps(_build_network_info(i))}, }) def build_expected_peer(i): return {'availability_zone': 'zone' + str(i), 'network_info': [ {'id': '8cbd0080-bdb0-4714-8322-9370c9249851', 'network': { 'id': 'f2940cd1-f382-4163-a18f-c8f937c99157', 'label': 'private', 'subnets': [{'cidr': '10.11.12.0/24', 'ips': [{ 'address': '10.11.12.' + str(i), 'type': 'fixed', 'version': 4}], 'version': 4}, {'cidr': None, 'ips': [], 'version': None}]}}], 'reservation_id': 'r-xxxxxxxx', 'security_groups': [{'name': 'sg' + str(i)}], 'uuid': 'b65cee2f-8c69-4aeb-be2f-f79742548fc' + str(i)} peers_conductor_data = [] expected_peers = [] for i in [1, 2, 3]: peers_conductor_data.append(build_peer_conductor_data(i)) expected_peers.append(build_expected_peer(i)) def fake_instance_get_all_by_filters(ctxt, filters): return peers_conductor_data capi = conductor_api.LocalAPI() self.stubs.Set(capi, 'instance_get_all_by_filters', fake_instance_get_all_by_filters) inst = self.instance.obj_clone() mdinst = fake_InstanceMetadata(self.stubs, inst, conductor_api=capi) # Test peers.json present in list of endpoints self.assertIn('peers.json', mdinst.lookup("/openstack/2014-04-01")) # Test peers.json not present in older versions self.assertRaises(base.InvalidMetadataPath, mdinst.lookup, "/openstack/2012-08-10/peers.json") # Test peers.json is as we expect peers_json = mdinst.lookup("/openstack/2014-04-01/peers.json") peers = json.loads(peers_json) self.assertEqual(peers, expected_peers)

DB: deleteion of an instance would not delete the system metadata

Ensure that the instance system metadata is soft deleted when the
instance is deleted.

Closes-bug: #1275479

commit_message:
Sync oslo.db.sqlalchemy

Closes-bug: #1276510

This patch syncs latest oslo.db code. The purpose of this sync is to
bring in a fix for an HA blocker issue.

b4f72b2 Don't raise MySQL 2013 'Lost connection' errors
eff69ce Drop dependency on log from oslo db code
11f2add Clean up docstring in db.sqlalchemy.session
...

Change-Id: Ie81a2c4410856f9a1f07f8e8d8f193ef3c5f21b6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/77/71477/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Needed because the models don't work for us in migrations as models will be far out of sync with the current data. """ metadata = MetaData() metadata.bind = engine return Table(name, metadata, autoload=True) class InsertFromSelect(UpdateBase): """Form the base for `INSERT INTO table (SELECT ... )` statement.""" def __init__(self, table, select): self.table = table self.select = select @compiles(InsertFromSelect) def visit_insert_from_select(element, compiler, **kw): """Form the `INSERT INTO table (SELECT ... )` statement.""" return "INSERT INTO %s %s" % ( compiler.process(element.table, asfrom=True), compiler.process(element.select)) class ColumnError(Exception): """Error raised when no column or an invalid column is found.""" def _get_not_supported_column(col_name_col_instance, column_name): try: column = col_name_col_instance[column_name] except KeyError: msg = _("Please specify column %s in col_name_col_instance " "param. It is required because column has unsupported " "type by sqlite).") raise ColumnError(msg % column_name) if not isinstance(column, Column): msg = _("col_name_col_instance param has wrong type of " "column instance for column %s It should be instance " "of sqlalchemy.Column.") raise ColumnError(msg % column_name) return column def drop_unique_constraint(migrate_engine, table_name, uc_name, *columns, **col_name_col_instance): """Drop unique constraint from table. This method drops UC from table and works for mysql, postgresql and sqlite. In mysql and postgresql we are able to use "alter table" construction. Sqlalchemy doesn't support some sqlite column types and replaces their type with NullType in metadata. We process these columns and replace NullType with the correct column type. :param migrate_engine: sqlalchemy engine :param table_name: name of table that contains uniq constraint. :param uc_name: name of uniq constraint that will be dropped. :param columns: columns that are in uniq constraint. :param col_name_col_instance: contains pair column_name=column_instance. column_instance is instance of Column. These params are required only for columns that have unsupported types by sqlite. For example BigInteger. """ meta = MetaData() meta.bind = migrate_engine t = Table(table_name, meta, autoload=True) if migrate_engine.name == "sqlite": override_cols = [ _get_not_supported_column(col_name_col_instance, col.name) for col in t.columns if isinstance(col.type, NullType) ] for col in override_cols: t.columns.replace(col) uc = UniqueConstraint(*columns, table=t, name=uc_name) uc.drop() def drop_old_duplicate_entries_from_table(migrate_engine, table_name, use_soft_delete, *uc_column_names): """Drop all old rows having the same values for columns in uc_columns. This method drop (or mark ad `deleted` if use_soft_delete is True) old duplicate rows form table with name `table_name`. :param migrate_engine: Sqlalchemy engine :param table_name: Table with duplicates :param use_soft_delete: If True - values will be marked as `deleted`, if False - values will be removed from table :param uc_column_names: Unique constraint columns """ meta = MetaData() meta.bind = migrate_engine table = Table(table_name, meta, autoload=True) columns_for_group_by = [table.c[name] for name in uc_column_names] columns_for_select = [func.max(table.c.id)] columns_for_select.extend(columns_for_group_by) duplicated_rows_select = select(columns_for_select, group_by=columns_for_group_by, having=func.count(table.c.id) > 1) for row in migrate_engine.execute(duplicated_rows_select): # NOTE(boris-42): Do not remove row that has the biggest ID. delete_condition = table.c.id != row[0] is_none = None # workaround for pyflakes delete_condition &= table.c.deleted_at == is_none for name in uc_column_names: delete_condition &= table.c[name] == row[name] rows_to_delete_select = select([table.c.id]).where(delete_condition) for row in migrate_engine.execute(rows_to_delete_select).fetchall(): LOG.info(_("Deleting duplicated row with id: %(id)s from table: " "%(table)s") % dict(id=row[0], table=table_name)) if use_soft_delete: delete_statement = table.update().\ where(delete_condition).\ values({ 'deleted': literal_column('id'), 'updated_at': literal_column('updated_at'), 'deleted_at': timeutils.utcnow() }) else: delete_statement = table.delete().where(delete_condition) migrate_engine.execute(delete_statement) def _get_default_deleted_value(table): if isinstance(table.c.id.type, Integer): return 0 if isinstance(table.c.id.type, String): return "" raise ColumnError(_("Unsupported id columns type")) def _restore_indexes_on_deleted_columns(migrate_engine, table_name, indexes): table = get_table(migrate_engine, table_name) insp = reflection.Inspector.from_engine(migrate_engine) real_indexes = insp.get_indexes(table_name) existing_index_names = dict( [(index['name'], index['column_names']) for index in real_indexes]) # NOTE(boris-42): Restore indexes on `deleted` column for index in indexes: if 'deleted' not in index['column_names']: continue name = index['name'] if name in existing_index_names: column_names = [table.c[c] for c in existing_index_names[name]] old_index = Index(name, *column_names, unique=index["unique"]) old_index.drop(migrate_engine) column_names = [table.c[c] for c in index['column_names']] new_index = Index(index["name"], *column_names, unique=index["unique"]) new_index.create(migrate_engine) def change_deleted_column_type_to_boolean(migrate_engine, table_name, **col_name_col_instance): if migrate_engine.name == "sqlite": return _change_deleted_column_type_to_boolean_sqlite( migrate_engine, table_name, **col_name_col_instance) insp = reflection.Inspector.from_engine(migrate_engine) indexes = insp.get_indexes(table_name) table = get_table(migrate_engine, table_name) old_deleted = Column('old_deleted', Boolean, default=False) old_deleted.create(table, populate_default=False) table.update().\ where(table.c.deleted == table.c.id).\ values(old_deleted=True).\ execute() table.c.deleted.drop() table.c.old_deleted.alter(name="deleted") _restore_indexes_on_deleted_columns(migrate_engine, table_name, indexes) def _change_deleted_column_type_to_boolean_sqlite(migrate_engine, table_name, **col_name_col_instance): insp = reflection.Inspector.from_engine(migrate_engine) table = get_table(migrate_engine, table_name) columns = [] for column in table.columns: column_copy = None if column.name != "deleted": if isinstance(column.type, NullType): column_copy = _get_not_supported_column(col_name_col_instance, column.name) else: column_copy = column.copy() else: column_copy = Column('deleted', Boolean, default=0) columns.append(column_copy) constraints = [constraint.copy() for constraint in table.constraints] meta = table.metadata new_table = Table(table_name + "__tmp__", meta, *(columns + constraints)) new_table.create() indexes = [] for index in insp.get_indexes(table_name): column_names = [new_table.c[c] for c in index['column_names']] indexes.append(Index(index["name"], *column_names, unique=index["unique"])) c_select = [] for c in table.c: if c.name != "deleted": c_select.append(c) else: c_select.append(table.c.deleted == table.c.id) ins = InsertFromSelect(new_table, select(c_select)) migrate_engine.execute(ins) table.drop() [index.create(migrate_engine) for index in indexes] new_table.rename(table_name) new_table.update().\ where(new_table.c.deleted == new_table.c.id).\ values(deleted=True).\ execute() def change_deleted_column_type_to_id_type(migrate_engine, table_name, **col_name_col_instance): if migrate_engine.name == "sqlite": return _change_deleted_column_type_to_id_type_sqlite( migrate_engine, table_name, **col_name_col_instance) insp = reflection.Inspector.from_engine(migrate_engine) indexes = insp.get_indexes(table_name) table = get_table(migrate_engine, table_name) new_deleted = Column('new_deleted', table.c.id.type, default=_get_default_deleted_value(table)) new_deleted.create(table, populate_default=True) deleted = True # workaround for pyflakes table.update().\ where(table.c.deleted == deleted).\ values(new_deleted=table.c.id).\ execute() table.c.deleted.drop() table.c.new_deleted.alter(name="deleted") _restore_indexes_on_deleted_columns(migrate_engine, table_name, indexes) def _change_deleted_column_type_to_id_type_sqlite(migrate_engine, table_name, **col_name_col_instance): # NOTE(boris-42): sqlaclhemy-migrate can't drop column with check # constraints in sqlite DB and our `deleted` column has # 2 check constraints. So there is only one way to remove # these constraints: # 1) Create new table with the same columns, constraints # and indexes. (except deleted column). # 2) Copy all data from old to new table. # 3) Drop old table. # 4) Rename new table to old table name. insp = reflection.Inspector.from_engine(migrate_engine) meta = MetaData(bind=migrate_engine) table = Table(table_name, meta, autoload=True) default_deleted_value = _get_default_deleted_value(table) columns = [] for column in table.columns: column_copy = None if column.name != "deleted": if isinstance(column.type, NullType): column_copy = _get_not_supported_column(col_name_col_instance, column.name) else: column_copy = column.copy() else: column_copy = Column('deleted', table.c.id.type, default=default_deleted_value) columns.append(column_copy) def is_deleted_column_constraint(constraint): # NOTE(boris-42): There is no other way to check is CheckConstraint # associated with deleted column. if not isinstance(constraint, CheckConstraint): return False sqltext = str(constraint.sqltext) return (sqltext.endswith("deleted in (0, 1)") or sqltext.endswith("deleted IN (:deleted_1, :deleted_2)")) constraints = [] for constraint in table.constraints: if not is_deleted_column_constraint(constraint): constraints.append(constraint.copy()) new_table = Table(table_name + "__tmp__", meta, *(columns + constraints)) new_table.create() indexes = [] for index in insp.get_indexes(table_name): column_names = [new_table.c[c] for c in index['column_names']] indexes.append(Index(index["name"], *column_names, unique=index["unique"])) ins = InsertFromSelect(new_table, table.select()) migrate_engine.execute(ins) table.drop() [index.create(migrate_engine) for index in indexes] new_table.rename(table_name) deleted = True # workaround for pyflakes new_table.update().\ where(new_table.c.deleted == deleted).\ values(deleted=new_table.c.id).\ execute() # NOTE(boris-42): Fix value of deleted column: False -> "" or 0. deleted = False # workaround for pyflakes new_table.update().\ where(new_table.c.deleted == deleted).\ values(deleted=default_deleted_value).\ execute() def get_connect_string(backend, database, user=None, passwd=None): """Get database connection Try to get a connection with a very specific set of values, if we get these then we'll run the tests, otherwise they are skipped """ args = {'backend': backend, 'user': user, 'passwd': passwd, 'database': database} if backend == 'sqlite': template = '%(backend)s:///%(database)s' else: template = "%(backend)s://%(user)s:%(passwd)s@localhost/%(database)s" return template % args def is_backend_avail(backend, database, user=None, passwd=None): try: connect_uri = get_connect_string(backend=backend, database=database, user=user, passwd=passwd) engine = sqlalchemy.create_engine(connect_uri) connection = engine.connect() except Exception: # intentionally catch all to handle exceptions even if we don't # have any backend code loaded. return False else: connection.close() engine.dispose() return True def get_db_connection_info(conn_pieces): database = conn_pieces.path.strip('/') loc_pieces = conn_pieces.netloc.split('@') host = loc_pieces[1] auth_pieces = loc_pieces[0].split(':') user = auth_pieces[0] password = "" if len(auth_pieces) > 1: password = auth_pieces[1].strip() return (user, password, database, host)

commit_message:
mask the mysql password from cinder.conf

This patch masks out cinder.conf's mysql://user:PASSWORD
password from the log output.  It converts the actual
password to 'xxx'.

Change-Id: Ia6c1630a28196dbd9d6b3b29cf354558258ed353
Closes-Bug: 1276865
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/20/71420/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sed -i 's/\(mysql:\/\/.*:\).*@/\1xxx@/' $TEMPFILE

commit_message:
Convert use_neutron_default_nets to BoolOpt

This option is boolean by nature, and setting it to StrOpt causes confusion.
For example, if you set this to 'true' in config file:

use_neutron_default_nets=true

then Nova will not use default nets, as string value is 'true', not 'True'.
Changing this to BoolOpt fixes this issue and makes the code more consistent.

Change-Id: Ib018fbff7a94af499dc1f44dab4f5353613cc721
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/47/66547/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add audit period to instance notifications

This patch adds audit_period_{beginning,ending} to
compute.instance.create.{start,stop,error} and
compute.instance.delete.{start,stop} notifications,
which is consistent with other nova and OpenStack
notifications.

Closes-Bug: #1269494
Change-Id: Idd25871d1ee1663ff4e6eedf105c6bf1d4d47751

commit_message:
Change package action to :upgrade

To achieve both uniformity and least surprise, it might be better to
always upgrade packages.  Before this change, it only installed some,
upgraded others.

If noone disagrees, I will change these package resources to honor
platform overrides and the corresponding tests.  (Feedback welcome :)

Change-Id: Ia76886743efddc783c484faef2db3668a7d66768
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-compute refs/changes/61/70361/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Volume-Host affinity weight which uses Ceilometer

Added a new weight for the filter scheduler that gets data from
ceilometer, if available, and uses it to determine the host where a
volume is placed, allowing the weight to give a good score to this host
or a bad score to any other.

Change-Id: I0e6d052a63e728e16538de7e5229e3cda9b0cc8f
Implements: blueprint cross-service-filter-scheduling

commit_message:
Auto confirm cold migration by default

Now in OpenStack nova, we support live migration, cold migration
and resize.

For live migration, we do not need to confirm after live migration
finished.

For resize, we need to confirm, as we want to give end user an
opportunity to rollback.

The problem is cold migration, because cold migration and resize
share same code path, so once admin submit a cold migration request
and after the cold migration finished, the VM will goes to
verify_resize state, and admin needs to confirm resize. Nova should
support auto confirm cold migration by default.

UpgradeImpact
DocImpact
A new parameter was introduced: cold_migration_confirm_window, it
will only handle auto confirm for cold migration.
1) Set to 0 to disable auto confirm to cold migration
2) Set to N to auto confirm cold migrations after N seconds
3) Default value is 1

Implements bp auto-confirm-cold-migration
Change-Id: I2d41a9267be27b109c22dea40b061967513353f8

commit_message:
Change index of brocade networks table from int to string

This migration changes the id field for the brocadenetworks
table from int to string (uuid). This brocade specific table
indexes using uuid.

Closes-Bug: #1271276

Change-Id: Ia5581f86d13e88df68b2c3eb283d3fe745a9d7c9

commit_message:
Make sure the path of default storage pool is used

Seed machine image got created at /var/lib/libvirt/images (the default
path for the default storage pool) even if this location has been
altered.

This patch ensures that the correct path is used, by checking the path
first.

Change-Id: I3e4ccff301524b8f08bba7099fafe5a9b4d3442c
Closes-Bug: #1276277

commit_message:
Remove asserts for optional imports

Horizon's __init__.py has some code that explicitly allows it to
be imported by setup.py before Django is set up, by making import
failures just throw a warning instead of an exception. But that code
is defeated by a bunch of asserts that were added later, that just
make the error even more confusing.

I'm removing the asserts and replacing them with __all__.

Closes-bug: #1210253
Change-Id: I0fde7810a033fd7216da9a5460f5e4e323b4d6e9
(cherry picked from commit b6eb9a2480a82cf93f7a62e9c7373feddc8296fe)

commit_message:
Added checking for slash of end in base_url

If don't check for slash at end of base_url, the error may occur
in tests because of appearance of a double slash in url.

Change-Id: I939d911e5114608cbde9d30cf0c4f435f2a2b7ac
Closes-Bug: #1271556

commit_message:
X-IO ISE iSCSI/FC driver

Initial check in of cinder volume driver to manage X-IO ISE storage
array.  The driver has support for iSCSI and Fibre Channel.

Change-Id: If96e9b0afed651d57629302cf053d6e2bea8932d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/98/71598/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # Copyright (c) 2014 X-IO. # Copyright (c) 2014 OpenStack Foundation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import httplib2 import base64 import string import time import socket from lxml import etree from oslo.config import cfg from cinder import exception from cinder.openstack.common import log as logging from cinder.volume import driver #*********************************************************** # 1) Get the IP or Address of the ISE to examine, # ISE Username, and Password # 2) Do an HTTP GET to /query (requires no authentication) # 3) Extract the 'self' attribute to get full info # 4) Do and HTTP GET for full info (requires login) # 5) Extract Status/Temperature and display it #*********************************************************** xio_opts = [cfg.StrOpt('san_ip',default="",help='SAN storage'), cfg.StrOpt('san_login',default="",help='SAN user'), cfg.StrOpt('san_password',default="",help='SAN password'), cfg.BoolOpt('san_use_ssl',default=False,help='Use SSL connection'), cfg.StrOpt('ise_default_pool',default="1",help='Default storage pool'), cfg.StrOpt('ise_raid_level',default="1",help='Raid level for volumes') ] CONF = cfg.CONF CONF.register_opts(xio_opts) LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class XIOISEDriver(): VERSION = '1.19' def __init__(self, configuration): self.ise_ip = configuration['ise_ip'] self.ise_login = configuration['ise_login'] self.ise_password = configuration['ise_password'] self.ise_use_ssl = configuration['ise_use_ssl'] self.ise_pool = configuration['ise_default_pool'] self.ise_backend_name = configuration['ise_backend_name'] self.ise_reserved_percentage = configuration['ise_reserved_percentage'] self.ise_raid_level = configuration['ise_raid_level'] self.protocol = configuration['ise_protocol'] self.ise_primary_ip = '' self.ise_secondary_ip = '' self.ise_sn = self.send_query() def get_version(self): return self.VERSION def _get_protocol(self): return self.protocol def send_query(self): """ Do initial query and fetch ISE SN """ body = "" url = '/query' response, content = self.connect('GET', url, body) if response.status != 200: print "query %s" % response.status reason = etree.fromstring(content) print reason.text connection.close() return xml_tree = etree.fromstring(content) reflist = xml_tree.find('globalid') if reflist is None: print "element not found" return None self.ise_sn = reflist.text self.ise_primary_ip = self.ise_ip controllers = xml_tree.find('controllers') if controllers is None: return self.ise_sn for node in controllers: print node if node.tag != 'controller': continue # found a controller node controller = node ipaddress = controller.find('ipaddress') ranktag = controller.find('rank') if ipaddress is None: continue # found an ipaddress tag # make sure rank tag is present if ranktag is None: continue rank = ranktag.attrib['value'] # make sure rank value is present if rank is None: continue if rank == '1': # rank 1 means primary (xo) self.ise_primary_ip = ipaddress.text print 'Setting primary IP to: %s' % (self.ise_primary_ip) elif rank == '0': # rank 0 means secondary (nxo) self.ise_secondary_ip = ipaddress.text print 'Setting secondary IP to: %s' % (self.ise_secondary_ip) return self.ise_sn def get_ise_primary_ip(self): if self.ise_primary_ip != '': return self.ise_primary_ip else: return self.ise_ip def get_ise_secondary_ip(self): if self.ise_secondary_ip != '': return self.ise_secondary_ip else: return self.ise_ip def get_uri_prefix(self): if self.ise_use_ssl: return 'https://' else: return 'http://' def connect(self, method, uri, body = ''): print("%s connect: %s - %s - %s" % (self.__class__.__name__, method, uri, body)) header = {'Content-Type' : 'application/xml; charset=utf-8'} auth_key = base64.encodestring('%s:%s'% (self.ise_login, self.ise_password))[:-1] header['Authorization'] = 'Basic %s' % auth_key h = httplib2.Http('',5.0) url = '' # see if we need to add prefix if 'http' not in uri: url = self.get_uri_prefix() # see if we need to add ip primary_ip = self.get_ise_primary_ip() if primary_ip != '' and primary_ip not in uri: url += primary_ip url += uri print("%s connect: %s - %s - %s" % (self.__class__.__name__, method, url, body)) LOG.debug(_("%s connect: %s - %s" % (self.__class__.__name__, method, url))) try: response, content = h.request(url, method, body, header) except socket.error: print 'Timeout' url = self.get_uri_prefix() primary_ip = self.get_ise_primary_ip() if primary_ip is '': raise exception.ValueError() url += primary_ip url += uri print("%s connect: %s - %s - %s" % (self.__class__.__name__, method, url, body)) LOG.debug(_("%s connect: %s - %s" % (self.__class__.__name__, method, url))) response, content = h.request(url, method, body, header) return (response, content) def send_cmd(self, method, url, params = {}): # 'command': (method, URL, {parameters}) def param_string(params): param_str = [] for name, value in params.items(): if value != '': param_str.append("%s=%s" % (name, value)) return '&'.join(param_str) #### body = '' if self.ise_sn is None: self.send_query() if method == 'GET': if params != {}: url += '?' + param_string(params) body = '' elif method == 'POST': body = param_string(params) elif method == 'DELETE': body = '' elif method == 'PUT': if params != {}: url += '?' + param_string(params) return self.connect(method, url, body) def create_volume(self, volume): LOG.debug(_("create_volume: called for %s" % (volume['name']))) if self.ise_sn is None: self.send_query() url = '/storage/arrays/%s/volumes' % self.ise_sn resp, content = self.send_cmd('POST', url, {'name' : volume['name'], 'size' : volume['size'], 'pool' : self.ise_pool, 'redundancy' : self.ise_raid_level}) if resp.status != 201 and resp.status != 409: reason = etree.fromstring(content) err_msg = 'create volume: %s - %s' % (resp.status, reason.text) raise exception.VolumeBackendAPIException(data=err_msg) # make sure volume is in operational state before returning location = '' if 'location' in resp: location = resp['location'] if location == '': resp, content = self.send_cmd('GET', url, {'name' : volume['name']}) if resp.status == 200 and 'location' in resp: location = resp['location'] else: reason = etree.fromstring(content) err_msg = 'create_volume: Could not find volume name %s (%d)' % (volume['name'], resp.status) LOG.error(_(err_msg)) raise exception.VolumeBackendAPIException(data=err_msg) volume_created = 0 retry = 0 while volume_created == 0: time.sleep(0.20) resp, content = self.send_cmd('GET', location, {}) if resp.status != 200: if retry < 25: retry = retry + 1 continue else: LOG.debug(_("create_volume: failed to verify creation of %s" % (volume['name']))) break root = etree.fromstring(content) volume_node = root.find('volume') status = volume_node.find('status') if status != None: if status.attrib['value'] != '0': LOG.debug(_("create_volume: Waiting for operational state (%s)" % (status.attrib['value']))) continue if status.attrib['string'] == 'Operational': volume_created = 1 LOG.debug(_("create_volume: %s successfully created" % (volume['name']))) break return 0 def create_cloned_volume(self, volume, src_vref): location = '' location = self._prepare_clone(src_vref['name'], volume['name'], 'clone') if location != '': self._commit_clone(location, 'clone') else: err_msg = 'create_cloned_volume: location is not filled in' raise exception.VolumeBackendAPIException(data=err_msg) return def create_volume_from_snapshot(self, volume, snapshot): location = '' location = self._prepare_clone(snapshot['name'], volume['name'], 'clone') if location != '': self._commit_clone(location, 'clone') else: err_msg = 'create_volume_from_snapshot: location is not filled in' raise exception.VolumeBackendAPIException(data=err_msg) return def delete_volume(self, volume): if self.ise_sn is None: self.send_query() #first unpresent volume from all hosts self._alloc_location(volume, '', 1) # location pointer for volume comes back # in Location header url = '/storage/arrays/%s/volumes' % self.ise_sn resp, content = self.send_cmd('GET', url, {'name' : volume['name']}) if resp.status != 200: reason = etree.fromstring(content) LOG.error(_("delete_volume: Could not find volume name %s (%d)" % (volume['name'], resp.status))) print resp.status, reason.text return resp = self.send_cmd('DELETE', resp['location'], {})[0] if resp.status == 204: LOG.debug(_("delete_volume: volume %s deleted (%d)" % (volume['name'], resp.status))) return def extend_volume(self, volume, new_size): if self.ise_sn is None: self.send_query() # location pointer for volume comes back # in Location header url = '/storage/arrays/%s/volumes' % self.ise_sn resp, content = self.send_cmd('GET', url, {'name' : volume['name']}) if resp.status != 200: reason = etree.fromstring(content) print resp.status, reason.text return resp = self.send_cmd('PUT', resp['location'], {'size' : new_size})[0] if resp.status == 201: LOG.debug(_("volume %s expanded to %d" % (volume['name'], new_size))) return def get_pool_capacity(self, pool): total = 0 free = 0 if self.ise_sn is None: self.send_query() url = '/storage/pools' response, content = self.send_cmd('GET', url, {}) if response.status != 200: print "pool_info %s" % response.status return (total, free) xml_tree = etree.fromstring(content) for child in xml_tree: id = child.find('id') if id.text == pool: availtag = child.find('available') free = int(availtag.get('total')) usedtag = child.find('used') used = int(usedtag.get('total')) total = free + used return (total, free) def update_volume_stats(self): data = {} data["vendor_name"] = 'X-IO' data["driver_version"] = self.get_version() data["storage_protocol"] = self._get_protocol() data['reserved_percentage'] = 0 data['QoS_support'] = False data["volume_backend_name"] = self.ise_backend_name or self.__class__.__name__ (total, free) = self.get_pool_capacity(self.ise_pool) data['total_capacity_gb'] = total data['free_capacity_gb'] = free return data def _find_target_ip(self): if self.ise_sn is None: self.send_query() target_ip = '' url = '/storage/arrays/%s/ionetworks'%self.ise_sn response, content = self.send_cmd('GET', url, {}) if response.status != 200: return target_ip # Got good response root = etree.fromstring(content) for element in root.iter(): if element.tag != 'ionetwork': continue ioports = element.find('ioports') if ioports == None: continue index = 1 for ioport in ioports: linkstatus = ioport.find('linkstatus') if linkstatus.text == 'Connected': break index += 1 ipaddress = 'ipaddress%d' % (index) target_ip = element.find(ipaddress).text if target_ip != '' and target_ip != None: # found what we are looking for break return target_ip def find_target_chap(self): if self.ise_sn is None: self.send_query() chap = {} chap['chap_user'] = '' chap['chap_passwd'] = '' url = '/storage/arrays/%s/ionetworks'%self.ise_sn response, content = self.send_cmd('GET', url, {}) if response.status != 200: return chap # Got a good response root = etree.fromstring(content) for element in root.iter(): if element.tag != 'chap': continue chapin = element.find('chapin') if chapin == None: continue if chapin.attrib['value'] != '1': continue # CHAP is enabled. Store username / pw chap_user = chapin.find('username') if chap_user != None: chap['chap_user'] = chap_user chap_passwd = chapin.find('password') if chap_passwd != None: chap['chap_passwd'] = chap_passwd break return chap def find_target_endpoint(self): if self.ise_sn is None: self.send_query() target = '' url = '/storage/arrays/%s/endpoints'%self.ise_sn response, content = self.send_cmd('GET', url, {}) if response.status == 200: root = etree.fromstring(content) for element in root.iter(): if element.tag != 'endpoint': continue endpoint_type = element.attrib['type'] if endpoint_type != 'array': continue ep_prot = element.find('protocol') if ep_prot != None and string.upper(ep_prot.text) == string.upper(self.protocol): global_id = element.find('globalid') if global_id != None: target = global_id.text break return target def _find_target_lun(self, location): if self.ise_sn is None: self.send_query() lun = '' response, content = self.send_cmd('GET', location, {}) if response.status == 200: xml_tree = etree.fromstring(content) allocation = xml_tree.find('allocation') if allocation != None: luntag = allocation.find('lun') if luntag != None: lun = luntag.text else: print response.status reason = etree.fromstring(content) print reason.text return lun def _alloc_location(self, volume, initiator, delete = 0): """Find location string for allocation""" if self.ise_sn is None: self.send_query() location = '' url = '/storage/arrays/%s/allocations'% self.ise_sn response, content = self.send_cmd('GET', url, {'name' : volume['name'], 'hostendpoint' : initiator}) if response.status != 200: reason = etree.fromstring(content) print response.status, reason.text return location # got a good response allocation_tree = etree.fromstring(content) for allocation in allocation_tree.iter(): if allocation.tag != 'allocation': continue # found allocation tag # verify volume name match volume_tag = allocation.find('volume') if volume_tag == None: continue volumename_tag = volume_tag.find('volumename') if volumename_tag == None: continue volumename = volumename_tag.text if volumename != volume['name']: continue # verified volume name match # find endpoints list endpoints = allocation.find('endpoints') if endpoints == None: continue # found endpoints list for endpoint in endpoints.iter(): if initiator != '': gid = endpoint.find('globalid') if gid == None or gid.text != initiator: continue # found initiator endpoint location = allocation.attrib['self'] if delete == 1: self.send_cmd('DELETE', location, {}) location = '' break else: return location return location def _present_volume(self, volume, endpoint, lun): LOG.debug(_("Presenting volume %s to %s LUN %s" % (volume['name'], endpoint, lun))) target_lun = lun url = '/storage/arrays/%s/allocations'% self.ise_sn params = {} params = {'volumename' : volume['name'], 'hostendpoint' : endpoint} if target_lun != '': params['lun'] = target_lun resp, content = self.send_cmd('POST', url, params) location = '' if resp.status == 201: location = resp['location'] elif resp.status == 409: reason = etree.fromstring(content) print resp.status, reason.text location = resp['location'] else: reason = etree.fromstring(content) err_msg = 'initialize connection: %s - %s' % (resp.status, reason.text) raise exception.VolumeBackendAPIException(data=err_msg) if target_lun == '': # shortcut did not work - go the long way if location == '': location = self._alloc_location(volume, endpoint) # find target LUN if location != '': target_lun = self._find_target_lun(location) LOG.debug(_("Presented volume %s to %s LUN %s" % (volume['name'], endpoint, target_lun))) return target_lun def initialize_connection(self, volume, connector): """Allow connection to connector and ret connection info.""" target_lun = '' if self.ise_sn is None: self.send_query() if string.upper(self._get_protocol()) == string.upper('fibre channel'): endpoints = connector['wwpns'] elif string.upper(self._get_protocol()) == string.upper('iscsi'): endpoints = connector['initiator'] else: raise exception.ValueError() if type(endpoints) is list: for endpoint in endpoints: target_lun = self._present_volume(volume, endpoint, target_lun) else: target_lun = self._present_volume(volume, endpoints, target_lun) target_endpoint = '' target_endpoint = self.find_target_endpoint() data = {} data['target_lun'] = target_lun data['volume_id'] = volume['id'] data['access_mode'] = 'rw' if string.upper(self._get_protocol()) == string.upper('fibre channel'): # set WWN for target data['target_discovered'] = True data['target_wwn'] = target_endpoint elif string.upper(self._get_protocol()) == string.upper('iscsi'): # set IQN for target data['target_discovered'] = False data['target_iqn'] = target_endpoint # find IP for target target_ip = '' target_port = '3260' target_ip = self._find_target_ip() data['target_portal'] = '%s:%s' % (target_ip, target_port) # set Auth method if 'provider_auth' in volume: auth = volume['provider_auth'] if auth: (auth_method, auth_username, auth_secret) = auth.split() data['auth_method'] = auth_method data['auth_username'] = auth_username data['auth_password'] = auth_secret else: raise exception.ValueError() return data def terminate_connection(self, volume, connector): if string.upper(self._get_protocol()) == string.upper('fibre channel'): endpoints = connector['wwpns'] elif string.upper(self._get_protocol()) == string.upper('iscsi'): endpoints = connector['initiator'] if type(endpoints) is list: for endpoint in endpoints: self._alloc_location(volume, endpoint, 1) else: self._alloc_location(volume, endpoints, 1) def _prepare_clone(self, volume_name, clone_name, clone_type): if self.ise_sn is None: self.send_query() location = '' print("_prepare_clone: Name: %s Type: %s" % (clone_name, clone_type)) if self.ise_sn is None: self.send_query() # location pointer for volume comes back # in Location header url = '/storage/arrays/%s/volumes' % self.ise_sn resp, content = self.send_cmd('GET', url, {'name' : volume_name}) if resp.status != 200: reason = etree.fromstring(content) err_msg = '_prepare_clone: GET volume failed %s - %s' % (resp.status, reason.text) raise exception.VolumeBackendAPIException(data=err_msg) if 'location' in resp: location = resp['location'] # Prepare snapshot resp = self.send_cmd('POST', location, {'name' : clone_name, 'type' : clone_type})[0] if resp.status != 202: reason = etree.fromstring(content) err_msg = '_prepare_clone: POST volume failed %s - %s' % (resp.status, reason.text) raise exception.VolumeBackendAPIException(data=err_msg) if 'location' in resp: location = resp['location'] clone_prepared = 0 retry1 = 0 retry2 = 0 while clone_prepared == 0: time.sleep(0.20) resp, content = self.send_cmd('GET', location, {}) if resp.status != 200 and retry1 < 25: retry1 = retry1 + 1 continue root = etree.fromstring(content) volume = root.find('volume') status = volume.find('status') if status != None: details = status.find('details') detail = details.find('detail') if string.upper('Prepared') in string.upper(detail.text): print 'Clone prepared' clone_prepared = 1 break if retry2 >= 25: break retry2 = retry2 + 1 return location def _commit_clone(self, path, clone_type): if self.ise_sn is None: self.send_query() if path != '': resp = self.send_cmd('PUT', path, {clone_type : 'true'})[0] if resp.status == 400: raise NotImplementedError() def create_snapshot(self, snapshot): location = '' location = self._prepare_clone(snapshot['volume_name'], snapshot['name'], 'snapshot') if location != '': self._commit_clone(location, 'snapshot') else: err_msg = 'create_snapshot: location is not filled in' raise exception.VolumeBackendAPIException(data=err_msg) return def delete_snapshot(self, snapshot): # location pointer for volume comes back # in Location header if self.ise_sn is None: self.send_query() url = '/storage/arrays/%s/volumes' % self.ise_sn resp, content = self.send_cmd('GET', url, {'name' : snapshot['name']}) if resp.status != 200: reason = etree.fromstring(content) print resp.status, reason.text return # Delete snapshot resp = self.send_cmd('DELETE', resp['location'], {})[0] if resp.status == 204: print "snapshot %s deleted" % snapshot['name'] class XIOISCSIDriver(driver.ISCSIDriver): def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): super(XIOISCSIDriver, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) self.configuration.append_config_values(xio_opts) def do_setup(self, context): configuration = { 'ise_login' : self.configuration.san_login, 'ise_password' : self.configuration.san_password, 'ise_ip' : self.configuration.san_ip, 'ise_default_pool' : self.configuration.ise_default_pool, 'ise_use_ssl' : self.configuration.san_use_ssl, 'ise_backend_name' : self.configuration.safe_get('volume_backend_name'), 'ise_reserved_percentage' : self.configuration.reserved_percentage, 'ise_raid_level' : self.configuration.ise_raid_level, 'ise_protocol' : 'iscsi' } self.ise = XIOISEDriver(configuration) def check_for_setup_error(self): """Returns an error (exception) if prerequisites aren't met.""" LOG.debug(_("%s setup complete" % (self.__class__.__name__))) def get_version(self): return self.ise.get_version() def _update_volume_stats(self): """Retrieve stats info from volume group.""" data = self.ise.update_volume_stats() backend_name = self.configuration.safe_get('volume_backend_name') data["volume_backend_name"] = backend_name or self.__class__.__name__ self._stats = data def get_volume_stats(self, refresh=False): """Get volume stats.""" if refresh: data = self._update_volume_stats() return self._stats def create_volume(self, volume): self.ise.create_volume(volume) model_update = {} chap = {} chap = self.ise.find_target_chap() if chap['chap_user'] != '': model_update['provider_auth'] = 'CHAP %s %s' % \ (chap['chap_user'], chap['chap_passwd']) else: model_update['provider_auth'] = '' return model_update def create_cloned_volume(self, volume, src_vref): self.ise.create_cloned_volume(volume, src_vref) def create_volume_from_snapshot(self, volume, snapshot): self.ise.create_volume_from_snapshot(volume, snapshot) def delete_volume(self, volume): self.ise.delete_volume(volume) def extend_volume(self, volume, new_size): self.ise.extend_volume(volume, new_size) def initialize_connection(self, volume, connector): properties = self.ise.initialize_connection(volume, connector) LOG.debug(_("XIO ISE ISCSI properties: %s") % (properties)) return {'driver_volume_type': 'iscsi', 'data': properties } def terminate_connection(self,volume,connector, **kwargs): self.ise.terminate_connection(volume, connector) def create_export(self, context, volume): """Irrelevant for XIO volumes""" pass def ensure_export(self, context, volume): """Irrelevant for XIO volumes.""" pass def remove_export(self, context, volume): """Irrelevant for XIO volumes.""" pass def create_snapshot(self, snapshot): self.ise.create_snapshot(snapshot) def delete_snapshot(self, snapshot): self.ise.delete_snapshot(snapshot) class XIOFibreChannelDriver(driver.FibreChannelDriver): def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): super(XIOFibreChannelDriver, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) self.configuration.append_config_values(xio_opts) def do_setup(self, context): configuration = { 'ise_login' : self.configuration.san_login, 'ise_password' : self.configuration.san_password, 'ise_ip' : self.configuration.san_ip, 'ise_default_pool' : self.configuration.ise_default_pool, 'ise_use_ssl' : self.configuration.san_use_ssl, 'ise_backend_name' : self.configuration.safe_get('volume_backend_name'), 'ise_reserved_percentage' : self.configuration.reserved_percentage, 'ise_raid_level' : self.configuration.ise_raid_level, 'ise_protocol' : 'fibre channel' } self.ise = XIOISEDriver(configuration) def check_for_setup_error(self): """Returns an error (exception) if prerequisites aren't met.""" LOG.debug(_("%s setup complete" % (self.__class__.__name__))) def get_version(self): return self.ise.get_version() def _update_volume_stats(self): """Retrieve stats info from volume group.""" data = self.ise.update_volume_stats() backend_name = self.configuration.safe_get('volume_backend_name') data["volume_backend_name"] = backend_name or self.__class__.__name__ self._stats = data def get_volume_stats(self, refresh=False): """Get volume stats.""" if refresh: self._update_volume_stats() return self._stats def create_volume(self, volume): self.ise.create_volume(volume) def create_cloned_volume(self, volume, src_vref): self.ise.create_cloned_volume(volume, src_vref) def create_volume_from_snapshot(self, volume, snapshot): self.ise.create_volume_from_snapshot(volume, snapshot) def delete_volume(self, volume): self.ise.delete_volume(volume) def extend_volume(self, volume, new_size): self.ise.extend_volume(volume, new_size) def initialize_connection(self, volume, connector): properties = self.ise.initialize_connection(volume, connector) LOG.debug(_("XIO ISE Fibre Channel properties: %s") % (properties)) return {'driver_volume_type': 'fibre channel', 'data': properties } def terminate_connection(self,volume,connector, **kwargs): self.ise.terminate_connection(volume, connector) def create_export(self, context, volume): """Irrelevant for XIO volumes""" pass def ensure_export(self, context, volume): """Irrelevant for XIO volumes.""" pass def remove_export(self, context, volume): """Irrelevant for XIO volumes.""" pass def create_snapshot(self, snapshot): self.ise.create_snapshot(snapshot) def delete_snapshot(self, snapshot): self.ise.delete_snapshot(snapshot)

commit_message:
Migrate opt_in_group() and opt() to a fixture

Create a configuration fixture to support registering arbitrary
configuration options and migrate away from the use of
opt_in_group() and opt().  Most uses of opt_in_group() calls
from .setUp() were moved into moved into the .config() method on
the test case class.

Change-Id: I94fd57f4e24826f26c5ab09779f0583737a9737a
bp: keystone-parallel-testing

commit_message:
Devtest Overcloud all-in-one support.

If OVERCLOUD_ALL_IN_ONE is set builds the overcloud
by using a single image. This is useful if you want
to save memory or only have access to a single
bare metal overcloud machine.

This is something we've supported in the old TOCI scripts and
it has proven useful to some of us.

For now the all-in-one commands are all undocumented.

Change-Id: I392322b79b4635d77047f020bbd40e4a4676ac28

commit_message:
Midonet plugin, set __native_bulk_support correctly

__native_bulk_support was incorrectly set to False, thus the
unit tests handling bulk operations were skipped.
Added a fix for chains bulk create

Closes-bug: 1237412
Change-Id: I46ea0e4c2668e59ca787ae9e68fb8bf660312712
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/65/50665/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: __native_bulk_support = True """Create a single security group rule.""" bulk_rule = {'security_group_rules': [security_group_rule]} return self.create_security_group_rule_bulk(context, bulk_rule)[0] def create_security_group_rule_bulk(self, context, security_group_rule): """Create multiple security group rules Create multiple security group rules in the Neutron DB and corresponding MidoNet resources in its data store. LOG.debug(_("MidonetPluginV2.create_security_group_rule_bulk called: " rules = super( MidonetPluginV2, self).create_security_group_rule_bulk_native( context, security_group_rule) for rule in rules: self._create_accept_chain_rule(context, rule) LOG.debug(_("MidonetPluginV2.create_security_group_rule_bulk" "exiting: rules=%r"), rules) return rules
deleted_lines: __native_bulk_support = False """Create a security group rule Create a security group rule in the Neutron DB and corresponding MidoNet resources in its data store. LOG.debug(_("MidonetPluginV2.create_security_group_rule called: " rule = super(MidonetPluginV2, self).create_security_group_rule( context, security_group_rule) self._create_accept_chain_rule(context, rule) LOG.debug(_("MidonetPluginV2.create_security_group_rule exiting: " "rule=%r"), rule) return rule

commit_message:
Logs Nova-Keystone request IDs

This change gets the request id from Keystone that is injected
by the keystone client middleware and logs it with Nova request
id.

Implements blueprint cross-service-request-id

Change-Id: I50cbac4fa6cdeb3dfaaaba3b369d544c49b9e220
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/81/71881/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:

commit_message:
Make more dashboard options configurable

This change adds the following new attributes:

node['openstack']['dashboard']['password_autocomplete']
node['openstack']['dashboard']['neutron']['enable_lb']
node['openstack']['dashboard']['neutron']['enable_quotas']

Changing these will be reflected in the local_settings.py
configuration file.

Note that there are additional neutron options, however I've opted to
only do enable_lb and enable_quotas as we have a load balancer recipe
in the network cookbook, and enable_quotas defaults to True.  The
remaining neutron options can also be turned into attributes if/when we
support that functionality.

Change-Id: I6fd9f7df58f46861c6fa8d8c6ed502fb554d951e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-dashboard refs/changes/51/73651/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: it 'has default enable_lbaas setting' do expect(chef_run).to render_file(file.name).with_content('\'enable_lb\': False') end it 'has configurable enable_lbaas setting' do node.set['openstack']['dashboard']['neutron']['enable_lb'] = true expect(chef_run).to render_file(file.name).with_content('\'enable_lb\': True') end it 'has default enable_quotas setting' do expect(chef_run).to render_file(file.name).with_content('\'enable_quotas\': True') end it 'has configurable enable_quotas setting' do node.set['openstack']['dashboard']['neutron']['enable_quotas'] = false expect(chef_run).to render_file(file.name).with_content('\'enable_quotas\': False') end

Add rabbit/qpid notification_topic attribute to template

- Utilise the rabbit/qpid notification_topic attributes from
  openstack-common in the glance-api.conf.erb template.
- Write tests to confirm these attributes are set.

commit_message:
External interface shows as up fake

On the network topology router-mouse-over-balloon, the list of
interfaces contains one labeled "fake<some_id>" which is a placeholder
for the external interface.

This interface should be labeled with a much less confusing tag.
"extern" or "gateway" seems much better.

Closes-Bug: #1273774

Change-Id: I873f80244757f573778abcac746c32c26732c8a9

commit_message:
Update how dashboard's secret key is handled

Currently, you can override the 'secret_key_path' attribute but this
does not get reflected in the dashboard configuration.  This change
does the following:

- updates local_settings.py to use the specified secret key
- adds a default attribute for 'secret_key_content' which when set
overrides the contents of the secret key (useful if you have multiple
web servers running dashboard and they all need the same secret key)

Change-Id: Ia82947280a64f6b1ec693ee273ac386a71be57ad
Closes-Bug: #1279863

commit_message:
report port number for address already in use errors

* nova/wsgi.py(Service.__init__): Catch external errors
(socket.error is a subclass of EnvironmentError since python 2.6),
and log the port number attempted to bind to.

Closes-Bug: 1237961
Change-Id: Ia4eb46c76db855fc3168c5b7a233ce94d2ef7726

commit_message:
Adds support for the get_rdp_console API

Hyper-V employs RDP to access virtual machine consoles, unlike most
other hypervisors which support VNC.

In order to support this scenario, the get_rdp_console API has been
added to Nova. This commit adds the corresponding client side feature,
implemented in a way consistent with existing VNC and SPICE console
support.

Nova Gerrit commit: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/43502/

Change-Id: I86b814797d234f1eb49a7fa67ed27a9bcda034ae
Implements: blueprint hyper-v-rdp-console

commit_message:
Tune up report and downtime intervals for l2 agent

If the neutron server erroneously thinks than the l2 agent is down
it will fail to bind a port, which can lead to VM's spawn errors.

This patch aims to add support for agent checks flags.

Change-Id: If047c5d52d10a8ca9b1b765400bdd99a29550b1e
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>
(cherry picked from commit 30885efc1f7ee1b8490474399014f1f5c931097f)

commit_message:
Fixing neutron::server connection parameter

Previously, neutron::server's (deprecated) sql_connection parameter
had a default value, preventing the new/preferred connection
parameter from ever being used.

This change removes that default, permitting the connection
parameter to work properly, and extends unit tests to confirm.

bug introduced at commit 82552e79316a4ffc1c879dd3aaa1f4735a4a35a0,
change I300fc12092bca1abdd105e0c0c272f7fd49258ac

Change-Id: I116b482c620b5c44b88c1b801438a100343f6f9f
(cherry picked from commit af1fd0b6042c76fc48bae81d36a74b7a51d00fb7)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/14/71114/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $sql_connection = false,

commit_message:
Use six.moves.urllib.parse instead of urlparse

To keep Python 3.x compatibility, use six.moves.urllib.parse to
replace urlparse.

Closes-Bug: #1279611
Change-Id: Ib91cf439777a11dd4d7ed4472014d17942f7de86
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/83/72883/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import six.moves.urllib.parse as urlparse

commit_message:
Fix spelling miss of password_func variable

In novaclient/shell.py there is a variable called 'password_fun'
which isn't used anywhere.
In fact it's a spelling miss, and should be modified to 'password_func'
which is used in novaclient/client.py
This patch fixes this bug.

Change-Id: Ibb8e95a2efc77575dcc8544584c708c5c62b7dea

commit_message:
Optionally enable file injection

There is a patch up for nova right now that disables file injection by default.
This is a corresponding devstack change that only sets file injection options if
it is enabled in the devstack config.  This is good to keep around so that we
can easily turn it on for testing.

The nova change is id Icff1304fc816acc843f8962727aef8bbbc7bbaa3.

Change-Id: I5015f2c351b1d680c205d7f9a5204febca490b91
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/60/70560/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # File injection is disabled by default in Nova. This will turn it back on. ENABLE_FILE_INJECTION=${ENABLE_FILE_INJECTION:-False}
